>We’re looking for an experienced mobile developer to join the Yoco team to lead the charge in building out our native mobile payment capabilities.

Yoco is an African technology company that builds tools and services to help small businesses get paid, run their business better, and grow. We believe that by opening up more possibilities for entrepreneurs to be successful, we can help create more jobs, enable people to thrive and help to drive our economy forward.
>Build and maintain our core payments SDK and UI (Swift + Kotlin).
>Integrate new card machine hardware into the SDK.
>Provide a platform that allow other parties to integrate Yoco payments into their applications.
>Be a highly technical, hands-on and effective lead for a team of 3 - 5 engineers, including task planning and code reviews.
>Work with our Product Management, Design and UX minds to ensure that we deliver continuous value to our growing base of customers.
>Do the hard and complicated to make it easier and simple.

>You build re-usable solutions that others can use to avoid re-inventing the wheel every time.

>We are looking for candidates driven by data, passionate about the customer experience across the entire lifecycle, and who possess deep expertise in owned channel management.

column1: • Build out and improve the customer lifecycle. Monitor and maximize customer lifetime value strategies ensuring maximum profitability and retention.

• Segmentation Models - Analysis of current and future strategies.
• Analyse campaign results and give recommendations. Weekly reporting and campaign forecasting.
• Work closely with all departments (Product, BI, Marketing, Operations)

• Team player and someone who enjoys working with people from diverse backgrounds (highly valued experience as a team leader or experience managing teamwork tasks).

Yoco is a FinTech company. We focus on building tools and services to help small and micro businesses get paid, run better, and grow. We believe in unlocking entrepreneurial potential anywhere, in empowering people to thrive and in driving our economy forward.
Yoco was founded in 2013. Today we are a company of over 100 people all driven by a common goal: keeping the needs of our customers at heart.
column2: Our vision is Open Commerce and we want to do this to enable people to thrive.

column1: The TechOps team allows Yoco to create new customer value fast.
column2: This is the team that lays and protects the foundation so that we can build amazing things quickly and securely. &nbsp
column3: They also ensure that, once deployed, our systems are stable, and scale effectively.&nbsp

column1: • Lead the design and deployment of systems infrastructure for installing secure, highly available software at scale.
• Grow and shape a team of world-class TechOps Engineers to work by your side.
• Automate common functionality to empower various depts to manage their infrastructure needs independently.
• Implement, monitor and scale systems that support large amounts of data and requests with high percentage of availability.
• Deploy, update, network, compute, storage, and virtualisation infrastructure for our services and 3rd party tools.
• Work cross-functionally to understand the requirements for architecting infrastructure according to scale and volume of data.
• Establish best practices for security, monitoring, migration and expansion of business systems infrastructure.
• Own the troubleshooting and debugging of performance problems and architecture bottlenecks.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• Have 8+ years expert experience in designing, building and maintaining AWS cloud based infrastructure

column2: s experience leading a team of expert TechOps Engineers

• Expert in debugging issues, identifying faults and enhancing logging of software
• Are experienced in IT infrastructure and systems security, cloud or network systems management, and business continuity
• Have knowledge of Terraform, Puppet and Kubernetes preferred
• Are experienced in writing code in multiple scripting languages such as Python, Ruby, etc

• Works collaboratively across the entire organisation, balancing the needs of various departments with business pragmatism, managing stakeholder expectations, and tracking the various work streams into and out of your team.
• Are transparent, articulate and driven to succeed

At Yoco we create spaces to explore, we keep it simple, we stay connected to our customers and product and work towards mastering our craft. Joining our team provides valuable experience in your tech career.

As part of the Yoco team, you will play a key role in the growth of the mobile Point of Sale opportunity in South Africa. To support this, we have built a role-based organisation where every individual is given the space to focus and develop their innate strengths.

1639224,1037887,Lead UI Designer,false,true,false,"

If you are passionate about product design and interested in helping us imagine, and build, the future of Yoco, we would dearly love to hear from you.

You will form an integral part of the design team working very closely with UX architects, product managers, engineers, CX researchers and data scientists. As someone who is ‘surface-oriented’, you have mastered your craft of creating beautiful, intuitive interfaces (UI’s) across many screens and devices. You also have hands-on experience with user-centred design practices and have successfully contributed toward an adopted design system. You are a coach, diplomat and champion of design.
You’ll be part of building the tools that thousands of people use to run and grow their businesses every day. What are you waiting for?
• Develop and articulate a compelling UI Design vision for the team.
• Lead all aspects of this craft, starting with UI Principles.
• Communicate UI Design rationale with partners and stakeholders.
• Partner with product teams to ship new features and experiences in an agile environment.
• Partner with Customer Research (CX) and UX Design Architects to test new design ideas.
• Participate in user research and feedback sessions.
• Mentorship and feedback for the development of others in your team.
• Facilitate design thinking sessions with cross-functional teams.
• Drive the delivery and adoption of Yoco’s internal design system.
• Build trust and strong long-term relationships with application engineers, product managers, customer research and product architecture teams.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• 4+ years of commercial Product Design experience across.
• At least 5 - 8 years’ work experience within design, software development, or related field.
• Has developed judgment for talent and provides feedback to shape the team.
• Demonstrates thought leadership and promotes company public as a leader in design.
• Comfortable communicating at all levels of the organization.
• Develops and uses facilitation skills to engage cross-functional teams.
• Develops the process/approach for tackling a design problem.
• Familiar and has practice in user experience methodologies and processes.
• Current or previous experience in Financial Services – advantageous.

column2: As part of the Yoco Operations team you will partner with our external vendors and work closely with them and the product, engineering, data and finance teams - among others, with your key goal being to delivery the best possible payments experience for our merchants and manage issues in a manner that insures our merchants are never exposed to the inner complexities of the payment world.

column1: ROLE | WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?
As the Payments Operations Manager you&rsquo
• Payment issues from beginning to end, working with our payments team and external partners to troubleshoot and resolve issues in a systematic and timely fashion.
• Collaborate with the leadership of the payments, operations and data team to develop the area of Payment Operations into a high performing unit within the organization.
• Develop and design processes to manage incidents with processes that reduce the requirement for firefighting.
• Work closely with our banking partners to resolve systemic issues effecting our customers and to reduce the number of reoccurring incidences.
• Own one or more key relationships and manage all operational components of those relationships &ndash
column2: including on-boarding, escalation, and business-as-usual.

column1: • Organize and maintain regular communications with all your stakeholders and co-ordinate with relevant members of the team to insure that the proper operation of systems is maintained.
• Design and monitor reports and dashboards that capture deep insights into our business through leading and lagging indicators, visualizations, and early warning mechanisms.
• Support implementation teams within the technology team and across the entire company as a subject matter expert on payment operational matters.
• 4 years plus experience in payments at either a financial institution, regular or relevant payment operator.
• An affinity for systems thinking and continuous improvement.
• Strong analytical skills that will allow good reporting and understanding of problems.
• Good technical understanding of what goes on behind a payment.
• An ability to drive necessary agendas with external organizations, which will in turn bring about timely results without breaking hard won relationships.
• Exceptional written and verbal presentation skills coupled with ability to drive consensus.
• Experience working with external technology partners and vendors.

>Yoco is a FinTech company. We focus on building tools and services to help small and micro businesses get paid, run better, and grow. We believe in unlocking entrepreneurial potential anywhere, empowering people to thrive and driving our economy forward.

>Yoco was founded in 2013. Today we are a company of over 150 people all driven by a common goal: keeping the needs of our customers at heart. Our vision is Open Commerce and we want to do this to enable people to thrive.

>We strive to delight our customers. Our Data Analytics team works in the intersection between data, engineering and our internal customers - Product, Acquisition and Growth, Operations, Customer Support, Finance and beyond. The team is responsible for building data models from backend services with the desire to make data a genuine competitive advantage. We want a team capable of building an amazing platform to support daily decision making, long-term strategy, and provide best in class analytics to the entire organisation.
>You'll be a senior contributor in our core Data Platform team, working across a variety of projects to deliver consistent, quality-assured data across all functional areas. You&rsquo
column3: ll help us build reliable, repeatable data frameworks while driving best practices across all of our disciplines, building processes designed for scale and automation.

column2: >This role will be embedded within the core Data Analytics team, it's key to build strong collaborative relationships with analysts and leaders in each area, while fully understanding our entire suite of systems.&nbsp
column3: You will be expected to engage in the granular detail and the nuances of each system so the data models built will be fully understood, with clear lineage and a solid business understanding.

column1: We have embraced a remote work culture, so you&rsquo
column2: re welcome to apply from anywhere in South Africa.

column1: IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING?
Drive best practices for our Data Warehouse - framework design, logical data modelling, implementation, metadata and testing standards
Collaborate across the business to define data concepts, KPIs and dimensions in an intuitive manner, distilling complexity whilst still capturing the nuance
Lead the building of robust data models of backend services that support all areas of the business
Investigate and effectively work with colleagues from other disciplines to address and improve data quality at the source
Drive the thinking on robust models that enable data inclusivity so producing analytics is available to all at Yoco
• An experienced Senior Data Modeller/Analyst or Senior Data Scientist, a specific specialisation and deep understanding of data modelling

• Experience in working in either a growth-focused or technology organisation, ideally working together and collaborating with the data analysts, data engineers, and engineering team, as well as other business stakeholders
• Comfortable with a variety of Data Analytics tools and platforms from cloud platform databases (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery) with SQL, Python, and front-end tools e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Looker
• A track record of delivering results from data, creating business-relevant core data models and key dimensions that have a broad applicability
• AWS (Redshift, S3, Spectrum) for all of our analytics infrastructure
• Gitlab and SQL for our data modelling and warehousing
• Fivetran and Segment for extracts and loads
• Tableau, Periscope, Mixpanel, and Looker for our Visualisations
• AWS for most of our backend infrastructure
• 5+ years experience in a technical data role
• Very strong SQL experience, as well as optimising SQL performance
• Experience with building a data warehouse and data platform frameworks

column2: >Yoco is an African Payments company with the vision to help small businesses across the continent and the world better run and grow their business. We are at a key inflection point in our journey: We have just crossed 100.000 merchants in South Africa and are now in an excellent position to execute our vision of expanding our offering to more markets outside of South Africa. To help us achieve that vision, we are looking for a motivated and driven associate to join our expansion team to shape and execute our international growth strategy and ambitions outside of South Africa.

>The Expansion Associate will work closely with the Head of Expansion and the Yoco founders to design, shape and execute this crucial part of the Yoco journey going forward. You will play a key role in supporting our expansion all the way from formulating strategy to driving execution and supporting market launches and operations.

>Develop and support go-to-market approaches and strategies by combining public and private data, market insights and taking into account general industry and competitor trends from our regions and across the world.
>Take full ownership of the go-to market process – from inception to our first few hundred merchants in a new market

>Develop, coordinate and execute go-to-market approaches (from strategy to merchant qualification to technical integration, to KYC and vetting, onboarding and support) by working with internal and external stakeholders, both remotely as well as in market
>Support in replicating Yoco’s unique customer journey and merchant relationships in new markets through smart partnerships
>Work with on the ground teams in building out, qualifying and onboarding merchants
>Identify and play back key learnings and insights from new markets to the various teams across Yoco
>Collaborate with teams across the company to drive implementation of learnings and troubleshoot merchant issues
>Analyse the competitive environment and identify key individuals and companies of relevance for the success of our activities
>Support in further understanding and developing our next horizon of expansion opportunities
>Actively promote and live up to the Yoco values and company culture.
>IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
>You’re driven by the vision of helping small businesses across the world thrive
>You have a Technical / Economics / Business or MBA background or you are an entrepreneur yourself
>3+ years of work experience, preferably in consulting, banking, the financial services industry, other high-growth technology companies or your own business
>You’re an entrepreneur at heart, love getting your hands dirty and solving problems
>Experience in international work environments, both remotely and in person
>Previous experience of successfully developing and growing businesses / business lines / side projects
>Proven ability to lead cross-functional project teams and interact with stakeholders at all levels
>Going the extra mile is part of your DNA
>Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
>Ability to easily adapt to a number of environments and tasks
>Can drive your own boat: the ability to fearlessly use the resources at your fingertips to resolve challenges especially when you don't know the answer
>Previous experience in activities related to geographic and / or regional company expansion
>Previous Experience in the financial services industry, ideally payments

>At Yoco, we care deeply about the success of our merchants. Our financial platform provides micro and small businesses with access to payments, capital and business tools that enable them to grow. Our customer success team looks after our merchants from sales to support, ensuring that our merchants are delighted across the customer journey.

>We expect the Head of Customer Success to equip and set up the team to be able to meet demand and be proactive. Our business is scaling rapidly, typically at a rate of 2X per year, and you will be expected to build a customer success team and organisational system that remains ahead of the curve as we scale up to over 200k monthly active merchants in the next two years.. This role will lead a team of customer success specialists that work on the front lines, fielding questions over phone, email, chat and social media. Beyond support, the customer success team works proactively in partnership with merchants to uplift their customer experience and enable them to grow. column1: The Outbound Sales Team, and the whole Yoco company in general, is experiencing rapid growth, and with all of this going on, we&rsquo
column2: ve got sales on the brain. Ok, who are we kidding? We always have sales on the brain. Over the last past few months we have noticed a rapid interest of Yoco within the Gauteng Province.

column1: The Outbound Sales candidate will be expected assist in crushing our monthly goals as well as their own personal Targets set out. So, what exactly will you do?

The Outbound Sales candidate is expected to prospect super targeted leads based around specific accounts/markets/areas that have been identified as ideal customers. From there, the incumbent will manage their day around building meaningful relationships while prospecting and demonstrating our Yoco offering to interested businesses.

• Work directly with customers face to face and via telephone, and email to describe products and/or services in order to persuade potential and current customers to purchase new products and/or services.
• Educates customers on product offerings and services to improve their ""on-line presence"" and explains pricing and answers questions from customers building value in the customer relationship.
• Follows up with customer via telephone or email following initial sales contact.
• Identifies customer issues and provides appropriate solutions via up sell of additional products and or services and obtains customer commitment and facilitates delivery of product.
• Complete basic Rates Negotiation with Merchants where required.
• Provide alternative solutions for integration possibilities and have the ability to discuss the usage and services listed of these products.
• Continued product education to better service customer calls.
• Maintains accurate daily record of sales in sales tracker.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• Minimum of 2 years' experience in B2B sales in a high volume fast, paced environment - preferably outbound.
• Strategical business understanding of the geographical and industrial market in the Gauteng region - more specifically Pretoria.
• Previous experience and/or strong interest in outbound sales and prospecting.
• Good organisational skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritise in a high-volume, fast paced environment.
• Solid understanding and experience of Web Based Applications and CRM software.
• Ability to manage sensitive and critical client information.
• Need to have access to a vehicle for daily usage.
• Ability to work autonomously with fantastic Time Management Skills

1700049,1073086,Web Developer (Growth),false,true,false,"

Yoco is looking for a Web Developer to join our Growth Engineering team in Cape Town.

We are a proudly African technology company that builds tools and services to help small businesses get paid, run their business better, and grow. We believe that by opening up more possibilities for entrepreneurs to be successful, we can help create more jobs, enable people to thrive and help to drive our economy forward. And we are looking for people that can help us achieve this mission.
You’ll help design, build, and maintain the Yoco website as well as our portals using React, JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS to help our customers grow their businesses.

We’re expanding our Growth Engineering team to support the business and help delight our customers during this rapid phase of growth. The Growth Engineering team enables and accelerates the rapid expansion of Yoco through experimental projects, with an inclination for innovative work.
• Design centred thinking, with a meticulous eye for detail
• 3 - 5 years working experience, or highly skilled with less.
• BSc+ Computer Science, equivalent degree or self-taught

At Yoco we create spaces to explore, we keep it simple, we stay connected to our customers and product and work towards mastering our craft. Joining our team provides valuable experience in your career as a Developer.

As part of the Yoco team, you will play a key role in the growth of the mobile Point of Sale opportunity in South Africa. To support this, we have built a role-based organisation where every individual is given the space to focus and develop their innate strengths.

Everyone at Yoco has the opportunity to lead a project and become a specialist, enabling flexibility, collaboration and accountability at all levels. And you will be working with a diverse, motivated and skilled team.
Join us on a meaningful journey at Yoco, and help enable our merchants to thrive through Open Commerce!

Yoco encourages applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply. Open positions at Yoco are competitive and we often receive high volumes of applicants. If you have not received further updates on your application after three weeks, you’re welcome to request feedback.

column1:
1257178,821955,Senior QA Automation Engineer,false,true,false,"

Yoco is looking for a Senior QA Automation Engineer to join our team of technical professionals in creating quality software for SME’s across South Africa and beyond.

The ideal candidate is an eager individual who is wanting to take their career forward, is driven to continually improve customer value and increase internal efficiency through quality, innovative software.

As the Senior QA Automation Engineer, you will form part of the wider team that is responsible for the quality, development, integration and maintenance of Yoco’s range of internal and merchant/customer facing software.
• Contribute to Yoco’s long-term vision and strategy for QA and Test Automation.
• Pioneer the work of QA automation within the Yoco engineering team.
• Proactively look for opportunities to introduce and entwine testing automation and quality into the product development process.
• Enhance and maintain a framework in which to implement automated tests using a combination of Selenium and/or other frameworks.
• Extract test requirements from high-level product specifications and workshops.
• Continue to make testing an integral part of the development process at Yoco.
• Advocate for quality within cross-functional development teams.
• Actively coach developers and QA engineers on test automation best practices.
• Improve automated test coverage and UI functional test coverage.
• Contribute to our test frameworks and services.
• Train and mentor other QA’s in the team.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• At least 6 years’ experience in commercial Software Testing and Test methodologies.
• At least 3 years’ experience of Automation Testing experience required.
• 3-year tertiary qualification in a relevant financial/IT related field of study.
• Ability to understand basic coding and write basic scripts.
• Strong knowledge of all different levels or layers of testing (including UI, API, Unit, regression, integration, system).
• Experience in writing, executing and monitoring automated test suites using a variety of web technologies including, but not limited to, HTML, JavaScript, and Typescript.
• Comfortable working across web, Android, and iOS.
• Exceptional attention to detail with proven interpersonal skills.
• Logical approach with a passion for problem-solving.
• Strong ability to manage pressure and deadlines effectively.
• Have shown an ability to advocate for quality across different teams.
• Experience within agile environments and understand what it means to have a quality mindset in an agile environment.
• Can convince others (and rally them around the idea of) why agile software teams should have a dedicated QA role.
• Experience in working with Jenkins, Selenium or similar tools - advantageous.
• Financial Services/payments system testing exposure - highly advantageous.

column1: The Outbound Sales Team, and the whole Yoco company in general, is experiencing rapid growth, and with all of this going on, we&rsquo
column2: ve got sales on the brain. Ok, who are we kidding? We always have sales on the brain. Over the last past few months we have noticed a rapid interest of Yoco within the Gauteng Province.

column1: The Outbound Sales candidate will be expected assist in crushing our monthly goals as well as their own personal Targets set out. So, what exactly will you do?

The Outbound Sales candidate is expected to prospect super targeted leads based around specific accounts/markets/areas that have been identified as ideal customers. From there, the incumbent will manage their day around building meaningful relationships while prospecting and demonstrating our Yoco offering to interested businesses.

• Work directly with customers face to face and via telephone, and email to describe products and/or services in order to persuade potential and current customers to purchase new products and/or services.
• Educates customers on product offerings and services to improve their ""on-line presence"" and explains pricing and answers questions from customers building value in the customer relationship.
• Follows up with customer via telephone or email following initial sales contact.
• Identifies customer issues and provides appropriate solutions via up sell of additional products and or services and obtains customer commitment and facilitates delivery of product.
• Complete basic Rates Negotiation with Merchants where required.
• Provide alternative solutions for integration possibilities and have the ability to discuss the usage and services listed of these products.
• Continued product education to better service customer calls.
• Maintains accurate daily record of sales in sales tracker.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• Minimum of 2 years' experience in B2B sales in a high volume fast, paced environment - preferably outbound.
• Strategical business understanding of the geographical and industrial market in the Gauteng region - more specifically Pretoria.
• Previous experience and/or strong interest in outbound sales and prospecting.
• Good organisational skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritise in a high-volume, fast paced environment.
• Solid understanding and experience of Web Based Applications and CRM software.
• Ability to manage sensitive and critical client information.
• Need to have access to a vehicle for daily usage.
• Ability to work autonomously with fantastic Time Management Skills

column2: >Help us build the future of commerce and empower small businesses to grow.

>Yoco is an African technology company that builds tools and services to help small businesses get paid, run their business better, and grow. We believe that by opening up more possibilities for entrepreneurs to be successful, we can help create more jobs, enable people to thrive and help to drive our economy forward.

>Our Merchant Account team is responsible for everything that happens after a payment is made to the moment the funds are available in the small business owners bank account. We are looking for an experienced backend developer with a passion for scalable system development to join this team.

column1: • Design, build and run mission critical components such as billing, merchant payout and risk management systems.
• Work with other payment teams to allow merchants to accept card payments through physical card machines, online payments and other payment methods.
• Contribute to the evolution of our system architecture and help drive our evolution towards micro-services.
• Do the hard and complicated to make it easier and simple.

column2: >IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

column1: • You have 4+ years experience as a professional Software Engineer (More experience is even better!).

• BSc Computer Science or equivalent is encouraged.

1574025,997900,Senior Infrastructure Engineer,false,true,false,"

Yoco is a FinTech company.

We focus on building tools and services to help small businesses get paid, run better, and grow. We believe in unlocking entrepreneurial potential, in empowering people to thrive and in driving our economy forward.  Yoco was founded in 2013.
Today we are a company of over 100 people all driving to a common goal with the needs of our customers at heart.  Our vision is open commerce and we want to do this to enable people to thrive.

The TechOps team allows Yoco to create new customer value fast.  This is the team that lays the foundation so that we can build amazing things quickly and securely.  They also insure that that once deployed our systems are stable and scale effectively.
• Lead the design and deployment of systems infrastructure for installing secure, highly available software at scale.
• Implement, monitor and scale systems that support large amounts of data and requests with high percentage of availability.
• Deploy, network, compute, storage, and virtualisation infrastructure for our services and 3rd party tools.
• Work cross-functionally to understand the requirements for architecting infrastructure according to scale and volume of data.
• Establish best practices for security, monitoring, migration and expansion of business systems infrastructure.
• Own the troubleshooting and debugging of performance problems and architecture bottlenecks.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• Have 5+ years’ experience in designing, building and maintaining AWS cloud based infrastructure.
• Have hands-on experience on EC2, S3, EFS, RDS, IAM, Security groups, ELB, auto scaling, deployment and migration of environments
• Are experienced in debugging issues, identifying faults and enhancing logging of software
• Are experienced in IT infrastructure and systems security, cloud or network systems management, and business continuity
• Have knowledge of Terraform, Puppet and Kubernetes preferred
• Are experienced in writing code in multiple scripting languages such as Python, Ruby, etc
• Are friendly, transparent, articulate and driven to succeed

1589817,1007695,Business Intelligence Analyst,false,true,false,"

Yoco is growing quickly, and so is our data volume, variety and velocity. We are looking for an experienced and entrepreneurially minded individual who can help us keep up with the growth, and identify signal from all of the noise.
This function is critical in increasing the speed of learning and action taking at Yoco, enabling fast feedback loops to support agile decision making.
You will have access to a state of the art tech stack and will be able to conduct analysis at lightning speed, the only thing slowing you down will be the pace at which you can learn.

You will be joining the Business Intelligence team at Yoco, working with various business stakeholders and senior management to solve critical business problems using data to determine the impact of specific initiatives.
• Increasing data literacy and accuracy within a particular area

Key responsibilities are reporting and analysis on KPIs across various operational functions (Sales, Marketing, Customer Operations). Beyond simply preparing dashboards you will be involved in on-going KPI reviews and performance analysis with function owners. You will be deployed to particular functions on a project basis to solve core problems and make an impact.

You will be exploring key business problems with an analytical approach, going deep to identify the root cause and sharing this in a simple fashion, along with proposing solutions. You will be assisting in creating a nuanced understanding of the key operational functions at Yoco, how they interact and connect.

You will work closely with the Engineering and Data Science teams to manage and maintain the pieces of the data pipeline. You will be exposed to setting up and scheduling batch jobs to aggregate raw data into useable tables. You will also identify gaps, errors and inconsistencies in data tracking and work with Engineering to rectify these, you will also assist in creating a complete picture of all data within Yoco.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• BSc Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Information Systems or equivalent analytics/computation degree
• Strong communication skills, particularly data visualisation - creating insight beyond simply results
• Statistical and business literacy, including KPIs design
• Some integrations and API experience, along with systems thinking capabilities
• Very fast learner and keen to get your hands dirty early on with experiments and hacks
• Experience in Product Analytics or Growth Marketing

1560058,989441,DevOps Automation Engineer,false,true,false,"

Yoco is looking for a candidate who is comfortable building data infrastructure that scales exponentially year-on-year in terms of both volume and variety as more complex products are introduced into the ecosystem. You will be working closely with software engineers and data scientists to enable the delivery of actionable insights in real time.  This will include building internal products/tools, utilising open-source software to schedule data jobs, facilitate data flows and enable integration between the various internal external systems.

• You will find ways to turn manual, time-consuming tasks into automated systems - anything from scheduling data transformation jobs to operational process automation.  You will be free to use cloud services (including AWS/GCP) to set up servers/apps to this end.
Interact with many elements of the tech stack

• Our tech stack spans several databases, pipelines and third-party services - these all need to be able to pass data back and forth.  This role involves making sure that these systems operate as expected and will involve implementing changes and improvements in the way they operate.
• You will be working closely with the Data functions at Yoco - Data Science, Business Intelligence and Business Analysis - as well as the system engineers and developers.

• Part of this function will be to put code from the Data area into production.  This will involve ensuring that the code is ready to publish on our automation systems - be it a data pipeline job for airflow, a predictive model in python, a trigger-response job leveraging our data systems, etc.

• Put the relevant monitoring systems in place to alert the team when something has gone wrong with one of the systems or data sources.  Identify and fix the cause of failure.  Ensure quality of data passing through the systems
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• BSc Computer Science or equivalent analytics or computation degree
• 3+ years experienceworking with data systems and/or operational systems
• Very fast learner and keen to get your hands dirty early on with experiments and hacks

column2: >Yoco is an African Payments company with the vision to help small businesses across the continent and the world better run and grow their business. We are at a key inflection point in our journey: We have just crossed 100.000 merchants in South Africa and are now in an excellent position to execute our vision of expanding our offering to more markets outside of South Africa. To help us achieve that vision, we are looking for a motivated and driven associate to join our expansion team to shape and execute our international growth strategy and ambitions outside of South Africa.

>The Expansion Associate will work closely with the Head of Expansion and the Yoco founders to design, shape and execute this crucial part of the Yoco journey going forward. You will play a key role in supporting our expansion all the way from formulating strategy to driving execution and supporting market launches and operations.

>Develop and support go-to-market approaches and strategies by combining public and private data, market insights and taking into account general industry and competitor trends from our regions and across the world.
>Take full ownership of the go-to market process &ndash

column1: VALUE PROPOSITION | WHAT WILL YOU BE GETTING?

column2: >At Yoco we create space to explore, we keep it simple, we stay connected to our customers and product and work towards mastering our craft. These are our core values and provides every individual at Yoco with an opportunity to grow. To support this, we have built a role-based organisation where every individual is given the space to focus and develop their innate strengths.&nbsp

>Everyone at Yoco has the opportunity to lead a project and become a specialist, enabling flexibility, collaboration and accountability at all levels. You will be working with a diverse, motivated and skilled team who will continuously stretch you as an individual. &nbsp
><strong>Join us on a meaningful journey at Yoco and help enable our merchants to thrive through Open Commerce!&nbsp
>Yoco is looking for a Store Consultant to be based in our CBD, Cape Town Concept Store.
>This is an opportunity to work with a great team of people as we take on the opportunity of enabling small businesses to accept card payments.

>Our retail store’s purpose is not only to sell our products, but also to build positive customer relationships by offering technical advice and support as well as a pop-up store for selected merchants. You will need to be a self-starter with solid retail experience. You will need to be able to, in an effective and friendly manner, to assist new and existing merchants with live demo’s, support and sales of our products.
>Act as an ambassador for Yoco, its products and its merchants.
>Onboard new merchants onto the Yoco platform.
>Support and solve technical problems experienced by merchants.
>Ensure operational, sales and logistical processes are maintained.
>Ensure the store environment is ready for trade on a day to day basis.
>Maintain a level of communication with teams that operational teams.
>IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
>2-4 years’ experience in a customer-facing role, preferably with experience in the technology or digital industry.
>Ability to manage multiple customers at the same time and ensure that customers are having a good experience.
>Naturally service minded with a love to assist and help customers.
>Lifelong learner loves a challenge and is a true problem-solver.
>Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
>Able to communicate technical concepts and products to a technical and non-technical audience.
>Ability to prioritise and manage your time efficiently.
>Takes initiative and proactively seek out the resources needed to solve the problem at hand.
>Knowledge of payments and the mobile Point of Sale space.
>Experience dealing with small businesses and selling their products.
>THE YOCO FORMULA - HOW WE CREATE VALUE
>The Yoco formula is a validated approach to work and a set of behaviours that create maximum value for our customers and help us grow.
>Core Values - Our way of working to create value &
>Leadership Principles - How we show up, engage &
>Say what you think and challenge me directly
>Don’t let ego get in the way

>To support this, we have built a role-based organisation where every individual is given the space to focus and develop their innate strengths. Everyone at Yoco has the opportunity to lead a project and become a specialist, enabling flexibility, collaboration and accountability at all levels. You will be working with a diverse, motivated and skilled team who will continuously stretch you as an individual. To learn more about our culture, go to our #YocoLife page or subscribe to our Exposure Gallery
>Join us on a meaningful journey at Yoco, and help enable our merchants to thrive through Open Commerce!

>Yoco encourages applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply. Open positions at Yoco are competitive and we often receive high volumes of applicants. If you have not received further updates on your application after three weeks, you’re welcome to request feedback.

>As part of the Yoco team, you will have the opportunity to play a key role in the growth of the leading mobile Point of Sale and payments solution in South Africa.

>As Online Community Coordinator, you will form part of the Brand Marketing team and play a key part in creating a movement for small business in South Africa. You will form part of Yoco’s online voice tell the Yoco story by engaging with our online community. You will be involved with planning, posting and moderating content across multiple platforms.
>Through daily engagement and analysis, you will foster community spirit, offer optimisations to strategy and creative teams, and confidently collaborate across the business.

column1: • Respond to comments and questions from our online community and participate in conversations around Yoco and small business, as Yoco, on a daily basis.
• Assign relevant online queries to Customer Support and Sales teams, and ensure all queries are dealt with.Assist with planning, posting and moderating content across a variety of platforms.
• Stay close to the numbers and report on our online community regularly.
• Use insights gained from engaging in online conversations to assist in building out monthly content and social media calendars.
• Oversee the community management process and ensure our systems are being used in the most effective and scalable way.
• Identify relevant conversations happening online that Yoco could be part of, and engage in those conversations.
• Assist with building a Yoco Tribe and mobilising them to spread our message.
• Assist with on the ground social media posts at events.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• At least 2+ years experience in Social Media Marketing or Community Management.
• Degree or Diploma in Marketing or Communication related fields.
• Great English spelling and grammar, with at least 1 additional South African language.
• Ability to interact and collaborate with various internal teams and manage relationships.
• Ability to effectively manage a community management system and necessary tools.
• A love for, and understanding of, small businesses and entrepreneurship.
• Experience in communicating as a brand, within brand guidelines.
• Ability to prioritise workload and meet deadlines.
• Experience in running or working for a small business.
• Able to understand and speak multiple South African languages.

column2: ve got sales on the brain. Ok, who are we kidding? We always have sales on the brain. Over the last past few months we have noticed a rapid interest of Yoco within the Gauteng Province.

column1: The Outbound Sales candidate will be expected assist in crushing our monthly goals as well as their own personal Targets set out. So, what exactly will you do?

The Outbound Sales candidate is expected to prospect super targeted leads based around specific accounts/markets/areas that have been identified as ideal customers. From there, the incumbent will manage their day around building meaningful relationships while prospecting and demonstrating our Yoco offering to interested businesses.

• Work directly with customers face to face and via telephone, and email to describe products and/or services in order to persuade potential and current customers to purchase new products and/or services.
• Educates customers on product offerings and services to improve their ""on-line presence"" and explains pricing and answers questions from customers building value in the customer relationship.
• Follows up with customer via telephone or email following initial sales contact.
• Identifies customer issues and provides appropriate solutions via up sell of additional products and or services and obtains customer commitment and facilitates delivery of product.
• Complete basic Rates Negotiation with Merchants where required.
• Provide alternative solutions for integration possibilities and have the ability to discuss the usage and services listed of these products.
• Continued product education to better service customer calls.
• Maintains accurate daily record of sales in sales tracker.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• Minimum of 2 years' experience in B2B sales in a high volume fast, paced environment - preferably outbound.
• Strategical business understanding of the geographical and industrial market in the Gauteng region - more specifically Pretoria.
• Previous experience and/or strong interest in outbound sales and prospecting.
• Good organisational skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritise in a high-volume, fast paced environment.
• Solid understanding and experience of Web Based Applications and CRM software.
• Ability to manage sensitive and critical client information.
• Need to have access to a vehicle for daily usage.
• Ability to work autonomously with fantastic Time Management Skills

VALUE PROPOSITION | WHAT WILL YOU BE GETTING?
As part of the Yoco team, you will have the opportunity to play a key role in the growth of the mobile Point of Sale opportunity in South Africa.
To support this we have built a role-based organisation

column1: Please Note: Thank you for taking the time to apply for this role. Please note that, at times, we receive large volumes of applications and this makes for an extremely competitive selection process. Should you not receive feedback from us within 4 weeks (depending on the urgency to hire), this would mean we are unable to move forward with your application. However, should anything change on our end, we will definitely reach out to you.

We’re growing our marketing team to support the venture and help to delight our customers during this phase of growth. So if you're bursting with positive energy and chomping at the bit for a chance to join a young company that's changing an industry and business owners across South Africa, we want you.

This position is ideal for a highly motivated individual who has an analytical mind, a proactive inclination, a natural problem-solver and a wizard of writing. You could have a good undergraduate degree or if you’ve taken an alternative route but you definitely have valuable and relevant experience in high-performance environment.
• Valuable learning opportunities from seasoned professionals with an entrepreneurial spirit.
• Insight into the runnings of a high growth, innovative startup.

<li><span class="" author-d-iz88z86z86za0dz67zz78zz78zz74zz68zjz80zz71z9iz90za3rz78zqlyz89zz71z6z86zunigfz77zz87zz72zevz84z9z74zz67zbuz89z8z73zz82z"">A superb working environment and an employee wellness program that will rival the likes of Google
ROLE | WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING?

Relevance and clarity boost conversions. Friction, fear and distraction kill it. Urgency is what nudges people to take action right away. You’ll be ensuring each piece of communication is working as hard as it can.

To do this you’ll create and edit content that will immediately answer the users question “why should I care” and effectively communicate to them “what’s the value for me, and how do I get it, now”. You’re sitting in the users corner increasing relevance and clarity, whilst making friction and anxiety a thing of the past.

With your (newfound) deep understanding of Yoco’s solutions you’ll ensure the KPI’s associated with the piece of work are being achieved. At the same time you’ll find the balance between brand, sales, clarity and be a touchpoint for other departments to sense check their public facing written work.

We’re an exceptionally hard working team, often having to wear 2, 3 or sometimes 4 hats in order to get our jobs done, and you'll work closely with all departments but focusing on those in the commercial unit - marketing, sales and growth.
• Editing content produced by others to ensure effectiveness
• Working with the data team to ensure content is tracked against its KPIs and that they are being achieved
• Ability to manage all aspects of your work independently
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
Key role requirements to perform responsibilities
• 2 - 5 years experience in a similar role is key. We’re looking for people who not only know what they’re talking about, but also those that can see hit the ground running
• A marketing or science qualification (degree or diploma), or similar industry experience
• Learn and figure it out - you already know learning is ongoing in this role
• Blue sky thinking, ideation tied strongly to strategy and analytics
• Track record of achievement in a similar role
Excellent candidates will have experience and knowledge of:
• Producing and editing written content that is aligned with an objective and inline with a brand
<li><span class="" author-d-4z65zz66zl57z75zyiz66zfr2fz87zwz89znujbz88zwz72znz76zz90ze6z69z84metqiz77zz73zgw0z68zo5k1bz65z"">Use of behaviour economics in your work
column2: persuasion, hooks, anchoring, priming, influencing. You’ll know them all.

column1: • Working on different kinds of content for blog posts, brochure copy, email, sms, in app messaging, support templates, ad copy and the rest.
• Elastic use of tone and style to connect with different audiences.
• You will work closely with the marketing manager, and will be exposed to all departments in the business.
• Make the call, get it right, achieve the results.
• Numbers don’t lie, work with the data team to report on your work and use them as your weapon of choice over unsupported opinions
• You’ll have the capacity to work in a multi-disciplinary team, demonstrate flexibility, versatility, initiative, diplomacy, dynamism and enthusiasm.
• Manage your own to-do list and make sure everyone is getting what they need. Also an expert in making time for important projects and chasing people down when they need to deliver to you.
YOCO EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO:
•  Strong communication skills across various mediums, building collaborative relationships internally and externally
• Diagnostic information gathering and research, analytical thinking, application of conceptual thinking to problem-solving.
• Demonstrate the capacity to achieve results
•  Proactive / initiative, customer orientated, fostering innovation, continuous improvement mindset, appreciation of results, business acumen, thoroughness and detail orientated
• Demonstrate the capacity to manage ones self-confidence, personal credibility, flexibility, adaptability and strong sense of personal accountability
Be aligned to the values
• Provide evidence of past behaviours that link to the Yoco Employee Values
VALUE PROPOSITION | WHY WORK FOR YOCO?
As part of the Yoco team, you will have the opportunity to play a key role in the growth of the mobile Point of Sale and payments solution opportunity in South Africa.

column1: Our offices are expanding from Cape To We’re always looking for great people to join our team. If you’re passionate about doing your best work, want to make a difference, and have fun doing it, apply today!
Get to know the product http://www.yoco.co.za  | See the journey http://www.yoco.co.za/journey

Payments is one of the largest untapped opportunities in South Africa. There are over 500,000 small businesses in South Africa that struggle to accept cards. Yoco makes it possible for any business in South Africa, no matter their size or setup, to accept card payments.
To do this, Yoco has changed the rules of the game. By transforming the ever so dull payment experience, making it smarter, simpler and delightful.

Smarter: Traditional card terminals are fixed, clunky and do little except process a payment and issue a paper receipt. Yoco offers an integrated cash register and card terminal that runs on your smartphone or tablet. Transforming a once disjointed experience to a more seamless, digital and mobile experience.
Simpler: Getting a card terminal from a bank. A once cumbersome, manual process that took weeks if not months, has now been reduced to a 1-step process that takes minutes.

Delightful: We've redesigned the card payment experience with both the merchant and customer in mind. The receipt is now paperless, the check-out time faster, the cash-up painless, sales tracking more accurate and more useful. With a goal of giving small businesses more time to deliver their great products and services, and customers more time to enjoy the goods they just purchased.

1933106,1205228,Events Assistant,false,true,false,"
Yoco is growing and so is our Brand Marketing team!

The Yoco Brand team is looking to recruit a passionate, hyper-organised self-starter who can use eventing platforms to help build our brand awareness in our target markets and help drive sales. The ideal candidate must love the challenge of seeing an event through from start to finish, must enjoy working with multiple internal stakeholders and external partners, and also display strong business acumen in terms of understanding ROI of event activities and the importance of driving leads and business from our eventing investment.

<div>The successful candidate will be working closely with our Events Manager to help grow Yoco events through various channels. We are looking for an energetic, reliable and engaging individual to join our dynamic team of change-makers serving our community of start-up entrepreneurs.&nbsp

<div>In this position you will be making a difference to the South African economy by providing small business with the tools and support to grow their businesses and revenue streams whilst building an eco-system of entrepreneurs and small to medium business owners. You will gain exposure to the inner workings of a fast-growing startup. From day one, you will be given the opportunity to drive innovation and execute strategies that will take Yoco to the next level.&nbsp
<li>Assist with the planning, organising and management of Johannesburg based internal and external events from start to finish.&nbsp
• Working with the Sales, Growth and Brand Marketing teams to ensure objectives of all departments are met through the eventing channel.
• Collaborate with internal staff, and external contractors to ensure successful event operations.
• Provide post event analysis, budget recons and participant feedback and incorporate learning into future events.
• Manage all Johannesburg event operations (preparing venue, invitations, food, drinks etc.).
• Develop strong product knowledge and be able to act as key product demonstrator at industry events and roadshows.
• Represent the company at industry and social events
• Assist with preparing and compiling marketing collateral, source new venues and prepare a detailed project plan and projected budget for each event.
• Coordinate site visits and scheduling of events, continuously updating our online events calendar.
• Build and maintain relationships with new and existing suppliers ensuring the usage of qualified supplier services.
• Manage suppliers output and their service delivery and ensure payments are up to date prior to events.
• Monitor payment allocations against budget and ensure sign off.
• Order and maintain marketing collateral stock for Johannesburg.
• Assist with the general operational and administrative requirements within the Marketing and Communications team and respond to marketing telephone calls and email enquiries.

column2: >IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?

column4: You will be conducting thorough analyses to solve challenging problems that lead to meaningful business value. The problems segment into two broad categories: (1) retrospective and (2) predicative.

column1: You will be examining current business process by evaluating the data generated, identifying issues and proposing solutions to increase efficiencies, enhance scaling capabilities and educate domain teams around the implications of their current actions. • Test for causation rather than simply correlation
• Use statistical and machine learning models to forecast future outcomes

column2: >We are a team of Designer and Product professionals who have effective relationships with many satisfied customers. We are committed to understanding the FinTech sector and improving payment processes for SMB&rsquo
>We are passionate about building solutions that solve real customer needs.
>Do you believe in collective vs individual genius and are you ready to be part of a team aspiring to collectively do great things?

>We are looking for a Senior User-Experience Designer responsible for conceiving and conducting user research (interviews, surveys, personas) before translating these valuable insights into UX deliverables (flows, site maps, wireframes, use cases, experience and journey maps) that are then brought to life through prototypes.

>You will then test the usefulness, usability and desirability of these ideas with existing and new customers to iterate and improve on the experiences. In performing this role, you will naturally influence and design the overall functionality of our product and iterate upon it to ensure an exceptional user experience.
>If you feel ready to make a dent in the universe, change an industry, and help African entrepreneurs and beyond, then this is for you.

column1: In conjunction with the product and design teams, identify concepts for new enhancements, new features, new user experiences and differentiation and distinction to existing products.
Help us craft usable experiences through your research (both market and user), competitor-analysis and the creation of service design tools (such as personas) where necessary and appropriate.
• Translate fuzzy concepts into clear direction through UX deliverables such as moodboards, sketches, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.
Deliver experiences that are optimised for a wide range of devices and interfaces, including phone, tablet, and web, and desktop.
Adopt (and champion) a user-centered design approach through rapidly testing and iterating on your concepts and designs.

column2: including design, product, content, engineering and marketing in a collaborative effort to share and implement research and user experience insights.

column1: <div>Encourage and promote UX and design thinking within the teams that you work with.&nbsp
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• 5+ years of UX design experience - designing complex solutions for complete digital environments preferable.
• Expertise in UX software such as InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer.js, Quartz Composer, and/or similar tools is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.

• Ability to collaborate and communicate closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model to regularly deliver design solutions for approval as well as understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet the needs of our customers.
• Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.
• A solid grasp of user-centered design and testing methodologies, subsystems, and usability and accessibility concerns.
• Ability to iterate your designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.
• Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.
• A clear understanding of the importance of user-centred design.
• Be willing to help teammates, share knowledge and experience with them, and learn from them.
• Ability to ask and answer, meaningful and impactful questions, be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.
<li>Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry&rsquo
• Great time management abilities, able to prioritise and start and finish projects without external guidance.

column1: Our Operations Team is looking for a process orientated individual who enjoys working with people and has their hearts set on improving the Merchant Onboarding Experience to join our team for a 6-month contract.

This role requires you to be responsible for the day to day payment operations of merchant onboarding at Yoco, for supporting merchants during the payment stage of the onboarding process and to have a strong ability to cross-collaborate in your work environment.
• Processing daily payments and reconciliations to bank account (whether upfront payments or part of the debit order process).
<li>Working with third parties to complete the daily debit order process.&nbsp
• Projects aiming to streamline certain aspects of revenue.
• Communications (internally across a wide variety of teams and externally with merchants).
• Finance responsibilities, checking proof of payments and reconciling amounts to the bank accounts.
If you have a love of creating and implementing financial processes and continuously seeking improvement to that process, then this role is for you.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
<li>Overseeing the Operations Debit order process for merchants.&nbsp
<li>Managing and maintaining external communication with merchants relating to orders.&nbsp
<li>Maintaining and Improving processes for payment onboarding.&nbsp
• An ability to remain calm under pressure.
• A thorough and methodical approach to your work.
• 1 - 2 years of commercial experience in a similar role
• Ability to solve problems relating to the Merchant Onboarding Experience.
This is an opportunity will allow you to:
<li>Work with close-knit and energetic Operations and Finance teams for an ever-growing start-up.&nbsp

• Make a difference to the South African economy by providing businesses with the tools and support to grow their businesses and revenue streams whilst providing support to an eco-system of entrepreneurs.
<li>You will gain exposure to the inner workings of a fast-growing start-up.&nbsp
<li>Learn valuable skills of cross-collaboration among teams and processes.&nbsp

column2: >The Outbound Sales Team, and the whole Yoco company in general, is experiencing rapid growth, and with all of this going on, we've got sales on the brain. Ok, who are we kidding? We always have sales on the brain.

>Over the past few months we have noticed a rapid interest of Yoco within the Johannesburg Market. The Outbound Sales candidate will be expected to assist in crushing our monthly goals as well as their own personal targets set out. So, what exactly will you do?

>The Outbound Sales candidate is expected to prospect super targeted leads based around specific accounts/markets/areas that have been identified as ideal customers. From there, the incumbent will manage their day around building meaningful relationships while prospecting and demonstrating our Yoco offering to interested businesses.
>Attend networking events and community events to generate leads.
>Vet lead list for warm and cold leads.
>Identify prospects that fit the target demographic.
>Attend training to stay up to date with the specifications of new products and service offerings.

>Work directly with customers face to face and via telephone, and email to describe products and/or services in order to persuade potential and current customers to purchase new products and/or services.
>Educates customers on product offerings and services to improve their ""on-line presence"" and explains pricing and answers questions from customers building value in the customer relationship.
>Follow up with customers via telephone or email following initial sales contact.
>Identifies customer issues and provides appropriate solutions via up sell of additional products and or services and obtains customer commitment and facilitates delivery of product.
>Complete basic rates negotiation with merchants where required.
>Provide alternative solutions for integration possibilities and have the ability to discuss the usage and services listed of these products.
>Continued product education to better service customer calls.
>Maintains accurate daily record of sales in sales tracker.
>Be a key ""Brand"" Associate and actively network and find new business or potential clients.

• Good organisational skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritise in a high-volume, fast paced environment.
• Solid understanding and experience of Web Based Applications and CRM software.
• Ability to manage sensitive and critical client information.
• Need to have access to a vehicle for daily usage.
• Ability to work autonomously with fantastic Time Management Skills

column1: Please Note: Thank you for taking the time to apply for this role. Please note that, at times, we receive large volumes of applications and this makes for an extremely competitive selection process. Should you not receive feedback from us within 4 weeks (depending on the urgency to hire), this would mean we are unable to move forward with your application. However, should anything change on our end, we will definitely reach out to you.

column1: ROLE | WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?

The Business Development team plays a key role in this next phase of our growth and has the responsibility of creating partnerships with leading channels and service providers with the objective of acquiring tens of thousands of new merchants (Yes, we are ambitious), creating new revenue opportunities, and making Yoco the best product that entrepreneurs use to run and grow their business.

As a Business Development Intern you will works alongside the Business Development Senior Team as the aim to create meaningful partnerships that accelerate growth or enhance the product experience for our merchants.

We are looking for someone to join our team who thinks differently about problems and values important relationships. This person will deliver value to business development team by using their analytical skills to generate to data to support informed decisions, draw on their creativity to support the business development team to build relevant and highly effective co-marketing programs.
• Strategy Development: Assist in Developing joint company strategic planning focusing on product offering, go-to-market plan, performance objectives and financial targets
• New Business Development: Proactively identify and assess new partnership opportunities and perform outreach to these potential partners.
• Performance Management: Continually revisit and analyze partnerships to determine patterns and make optimization.
• Yoco Ambassador: Serve as an evangelist both inside Yoco and externally.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
• Life long learner, loves a challenge, is a true problem-solver
• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
• You take initiative and proactively seek out the resources needed to solve the problem at hand.
• Ability to easily adapt to a number of environments
• You can drive your own boat: the ability to fearlessly use the resources at your fingertips to resolve technical challenges especially when you don't know the answer
• Eager to launch a career in sales
• Knowledge of payments and the mobile Point of Sale space
• Experience in Small Business / B2B sales

This extends across all levels of the organisation, both customer facing and internal.&nbsp

784531,530172,Executive Assistant,false,true,false,"
Yoco is looking for an Administrative Assistant to work in close collaboration with the four Directors to provide administrative support. Effectively helping the Executive team to make the best use of their time by dealing with clerical and administrative tasks. You will be the first assistant hired into the venture, employing 80 people across two offices in Cape Town and Johannesburg.

Yoco is growing fast since launching in late 2015 from Cape Town. The venture has on-boarded over 10 thousand merchants to use its point-of-sale payments solution, the venture is on a national and international expansion path. Linked to this are the growth of the team and general operations. Travel needs and general coordination of logistics surrounding the directors has increased significantly, and they can use a hand.

The executive team is looking for a level-minded individual who possesses excellent oral and written communications skills and can organise their work using tools and technology. Efficiency, a low-touch approach and general comfort with technology tools are essential.
ROLE | WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING?

We are looking for a responsible Executive Assistant to perform a variety of administrative and clerical tasks. Duties will include providing support to the Directors on general administrative activities such as travel arrangements and meetings.
Ultimately, a successful Executive Assistant should ensure the efficient and smooth day-to-day operation of the Directors office.
• Screening external phone calls, enquiries and requests, and handling them when appropriate
• Meeting and greeting visitors at all levels of seniority
• Organising and maintaining diaries and scheduling appointments
• Book travel arrangements, including flights, transportation, visas and accommodation
• Collating, reconciling and submitting expense reports
<li><span class="" author-d-16z86ztz122z98z81zz82zz85zunv3z82zpqfnlamlz122zxpz88zz88z4xqcz79z3xz77zz77z7z65zgz67zz90zz86zz65zz70zpoz83z"">Act as the point of contact for the Director&rsquo
• Liaise with executive and senior administrative assistants to handle requests and queries from senior managers
• Occasional support with personal administration if it impacts work responsibilities during business hours
• Keeping track of task requests and proactively communicating status
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• 3+ years experience providing direct administrative support to senior management or executives at a fast paced company
• Strong interpersonal skills, with a passion for administration and people
• Working knowledge of office tools and equipment e.g. printers and scanning
• Ability to stay on top of new tools and technologies with an interest and passion to constantly learn
• Proficiency in MS Office with Mac OS and Google Docs considered advanatageous
• Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritise work
• Attention to detail and problem-solving skills
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Strong organisational skills with the ability to multi-task
• Self-motivated and proactive with a strong sense of responsibility

column1: We are wanting a Sales Operations Analyst to join our team.
This position will task you with optimizing internal work processes in order to develop and provide ongoing support to the sale team.

You will build the internal sales systems and processes, manage the sales data, as well as the sales tools implementation and administration (namely Salesforce.com), to dramatically accelerate our performance against ambitious sales targets.
• Research, develop, implement and facilitate adoption of new sales systems, processes and tools, aimed at increasing sales productivity and efficiency.
• Gather feedback from sales, business development, and marketing team on a regular basis to constantly improve support program.
• Manage daily, monthly and quarterly sales KPI's.
<li>Input into quarterly target setting through sales capacity planning analysis&nbsp
• Contribute to sales incentive compensation design and administration.
• Develop and automate reporting and insights tools which can be handed over to sales and marketing management for ongoing use and evolution.
• Daily update and reporting of sales data reporting
• Design, develop and configure customized features and solutions using the full Salesforce toolset including custom objects and fields, validation rules, workflows, approval processes, etc.
• Provide front-line support for Salesforce system errors raised by sales. This individual will also play a large part in testing for new Salesforce.com releases and bug resolution.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• Technical and Process Proficiency - Salesforce Administration experience and qualifications preferred or a proven technical proficiency to quickly learn and perform.
column2: General technical and process proficiency to research, develop, implement and facilitate adoption of new sales systems, processes and tools regardless in choice of tool.
Be aware of key business objectives, and ensure these are applied appropriately to all business activities.
Able to develop effective relationships across all Yoco functions and gaining the trust and respect of individuals across the business.
Ability to influence both within commercial, and broadly across product, risk, data etc.

Effective communication skills suitable for the management of and liaison with departmental staff and senior management, both on a one to one and one to many basis. Demonstrate effective communication, both orally and in writing, with subordinates, colleagues, clients and customers including producing reports, preparing, organising and delivering presentations using appropriate tools and techniques, and taking a leading role in meetings and discussions.

Effective at determining a course of action by breaking it down into smaller steps and by planning and resourcing each of these, making allowance for potential problems. Must manage the field of responsibility within allocated budgets, and be able to plan and forecast future budgets based on business priorities.&nbsp

Effective in contributing effectively towards the objectives of a team, and be able to share knowledge, ideas and information. Aware of the needs, objectives and constraints of those in other disciplines and functions. Effective at managing people and can adopt an appropriate style to foster good team working.&nbsp

Able to solve problems in a measured and creative way. Capable of independently assessing a wide variety of tasks, and be proactive in relation to identifying and undertaking activities that are to the benefit of the business. Able to balance long and short term objectives, and understand business value. Be responsible for own decisions.&nbsp

Act in a professional manner, and exhibit the required behaviour that should act as an example to other employees. Needs to delegate tasks, responsibilities and authorities effectively. Effective at identifying goals and objectives, and motivating and leading others towards their achievement.&nbsp
Adapt quickly and fluidly to rapidly changing projects and under dynamic conditions (e.g., piloting multiple solutions in a test-and-fail approach)

• Naturally able to collaborate with internal stakeholders leveraging strong communication, written documentation, and facilitation skills.

• Formal qualitative research education (eg. Anthropology) or quantitative research education.

>Our engineers work in cross-functional teams arranged around missions, with a strong focus on aligning the right skills with the right problems and the right leaders to support them.

>Your focus as an engineering manager will be helping engineers with personal and professional development. You will also be helping the teams that our engineers are part of to become high-performing teams. Alongside this, you will be working with key senior engineering talent to drive cross-cutting technical initiatives to improve the state of the practice of engineering at Yoco.

column1: • You will take responsibility for related groups of engineering teams or specific discipline-based groups of engineers in teams and lead the technical strategy across those teams.
• Your impact will extend beyond your team into the larger organisation that you are a part of.
• Drive a culture of integrated cross-functional work in close collaboration with product, design and other areas involved in solving customer needs.
• Support and enable business objectives through the work you do with teams and with other leaders in the business.
• Support the engineering team in achieving a high level of technical excellence and stability.
• Advocate and advance modern, agile software development practices and help develop and evangelise great engineering and organisational practices.
• Contribute to engineering-wide initiatives as a member of our engineering management team
• Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
• Partner with senior engineers in your area to drive technical initiatives that raise the bar for our engineering practices

• You thrive on a high level of autonomy and responsibility.
