column2:
>We’re looking for an experienced mobile developer to join the Yoco team to lead the charge in building out our native mobile payment capabilities.

Yoco is an African technology company that builds tools and services to help small businesses get paid, run their business better, and grow. We believe that by opening up more possibilities for entrepreneurs to be successful, we can help create more jobs, enable people to thrive and help to drive our economy forward.

column1: Build, maintain and release our React Native (iOS and Android) applications as well as our React web portal.
Assist in providing a platform for other teams to contribute into our app, as well as contributing to the technical direction of our mobile and web assets.
Being a highly technical, hands-on and effective lead for a team of 3 - 5 engineers, including task planning and code reviews.
Working with our Product Managers as well as our design and UX minds to ensure that we deliver continuous business value to our growing base of customers.
Doing the hard and complicated to make it easier and simple.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
Strong React skills with experience building complex apps in React
React Native experience is preferred but not absolutely required
Experience in state management in large apps (e.g. Redux or other state management strategies)
8+ years as a professional Software Engineer.
You can deliver stable yet flexible software that allows us to iterate quickly in order to deliver features.
You build re-usable solutions that others can use to avoid re-inventing the wheel every time.
A clear, real passion for software engineering.
Strong ability to work independently while still being collaborative and inclusive.
Feeling a sense of excitement when offering input and contributing to the broader product discussion.
Proven ability in taking a feature or product all the way from conception to completion and release.
You enjoy providing technical direction and mentoring to other developers.
You feel empowered by learning and teaching new things and using modern technology.
You are excellent at solving complicated problems, understanding real-world issues and delivering high-performance software.
• Backend development experience, or API design experience.
• BSc Computer Science or equivalent is highly encouraged.
• Experience leading teams, designing and architecting products, working with customers

Passionate about building a world class, scalable data pipeline and warehouse? This is the role for you! Your work will be used to power the Yoco platform: by leveraging the rich data available, the Yoco Data Team is able to add real value to our customers and drive new product development, both internally and externally.
Launched in 2015 and already supporting over 9,000 SMEs you will need to be comfortable building a platform that scales exponentially year-on-year in terms of both volume and variety as
column2: more complex products are included in the ecosystem. You will be working with a team of data scientists to deliver actionable insights in real time and build internal products/tools from queries and analyses, to allow company-wide access and empower a data culture.

column2: >Your most important role will be to build and lead a strong team in their development to accomplish desired results that will help our merchants to grow and run their business.

>Our ideal candidate is someone who loves working with people, has a passion for helping others and creating amazing customer experiences. Someone who is patient, empathetic, and passionately communicative with our merchants, and can lead alongside a team is exactly who we are looking for!

Yoco is partnering with top retailers and telcos in South Africa to bring its payment and point of sale (POS) solution to tens of thousands of new SMEs (Yes, we are ambitious).

If you are passionate about Product Design and interested in helping us imagine and build the future of Yoco, we would dearly love to hear from you.

You will be an integral part of the Design Team working very closely with other Designers, Product Managers, Engineers, UX Researchers and Data Scientists. As someone who is naturally ‘surface-oriented’ you can craft beautiful interfaces, but more importantly, you also have hands-on experience with user-centred design practices and can lead the solution of undefined problem spaces. You are a coach, diplomat and champion of design.
You’ll be part of building the tools that thousands of people use to run and grow their businesses every day. What are you waiting for?
• Partner with the Product, Tech and Design teams to lead the design delivery of shipped features and products across Yoco’s services.
• Establish long-term relationships across cross-functional peers and management to align on strategy and priorities.
• Work closely with customer research, consumer insights and market data to inform product architecture decisions, user journey flows and wireframes.
• Facilitate design thinking workshops and help test hypotheses, product concepts and prototypes with user groups.
• Take the successful demo’s and produce beautifully crafted user interfaces for both the current design patterns, and the emerging ones.
• Provide product design direction, feedback and support during design reviews.
• Direct the teams efforts, provide guidance in technique and hold the team accountable for delivery.
• Help design, build and maintain a design system.
• Help scale product design capacities in terms of teams, tools, processes and structures.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• At least 5 - 8 years’ work experience within design, software development, or related field.
• 4+ years of commercial Product Design experience across Android, iOS and web.
• Proven ability to lead, grow and mentor a team.
• Proficient in Sketch, InVision, Abstract and Photoshop/Illustrator.
• Strong ‘mobile-first’ thinking, able to design for the unique challenges of various mobile devices.
• Ability to collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, developers, researchers, designers, copywriters and data scientists.
• Experience partnering with cross-functional teams in shipping new products and improvements to existing features.
• Develops and uses facilitation skills to engage cross-functional teams in design sprints or workshops.
• Develops problem-framing approaches which establish new starting points that lead to new kinds of solutions.
• Demonstrates confidence and can build trust with partners and establish long-term relationship comfortable communicating at all levels of the organisation.
• Connects team’s efforts with clear grasp of organisational context and customer ecosystem.
• Develop judgement for evaluation of talent and provide feedback for shape of overall team.
• Current or previous experience with design systems – advantageous.

column1: Join Yoco and help us to solve real problems for businesses in Africa, and beyond.

Yoco is looking for a Software Development Manager that wants to help take our team of Software Engineers to new heights. Ideally, you’re an experienced engineer that found a passion for the people aspect of software engineering, and you live to see engineering teams succeed as well as the broader venture of the business.

As a Software Development Manager for a team of fifteen professionals, you won’t be expected to contribute through code, but rather through enabling and coaching the professionals in our Engineering team to develop quality software. You'll be part of a strong product and technical team with the United goal of building products that customers love, with talented people. Your core job as a Software Development Manager is to amplify your teammates.
Through your work, you’ll have an impact on over 24 000 merchants.

column2: VP of Engineering, set the vision and strategy for the Engineering unit.

column1: • Lead, manage and mentor a team of smart engineers, engineering leaders and related personnel.
• Drive the hiring process across the engineering unit, working closely with the CTO on designing a hiring strategy and the People team to source and evaluate new candidates.
• Assist with on-boarding new engineers into the team and codebase, as well as creating new teams fast and effectively.
• Strong focus on delivery centric team development working in conjunction with engineering leads, engineering leadership and product to create a high velocity agile working environment.
• Conduct regular 1 on 1’s with the team, as well as engineering meetings as the team grows.
• Bring predictability to the team’s overall performance and delivery, owning release planning together with the VP of Engineering.
• Through regular 1 on 1’s with your team, establish a strong culture and keep morale at top levels.
• Identify and resolve any issues that are blocking or otherwise hindering the Engineering process.
• Manage the quarterly performance review process within the Engineering unit.
• Assist and coach the scrum master (or people playing that role) to do it to the best of their ability.
• Keep yourself up to date with the latest trends, techniques and technologies in your field.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• 7+ years of proven experience as an Engineering Leader or Software Developer/Team Lead.
• Solid understand and experience in any Open Source programming language (our stack includes React, NodeJS, React Native and Redux – exposure to this stack is advantageous)
• Strong customer-first thinking, showing deep empathy for people and customers.
• Proficient in the art and science of managing a group of technical professionals.
• Able to gain the respect of smart engineers.
• Strong ability to work closely with developers, product managers, and scrum masters, as well as executives.
• Able to mentor and share knowledge with Software Engineers.
• A pragmatic champion of Agile and an understanding that we use Agile to create customer value effectively.
• Continuously improve on the state of your craft, whatever it may be.
• Strong communication skills across various mediums, building collaborative relationships internally and externally.
• Passion for what we do, and why we do it and using this context to shape everything you do.
• A strong desire to create value at a high velocity.
VALUE PROPOSITION | WHAT WILL YOU BE GETTING?
As part of the Yoco team, you will have the opportunity to play a key role in the growth of the mobile Point of Sale opportunity in South Africa.
To support this we have built a role-based organisation

1693418,1069302,Graduate Software Engineer,false,true,false,"

Yoco is looking for a Graduate Developer to join our Technology &

We are a proudly African technology company that builds tools and services to help small businesses get paid, run their business better, and grow. We believe that by opening up more possibilities for entrepreneurs to be successful, we can help create more jobs, enable people to thrive and help to drive our economy forward. And we are looking for people that can help us achieve this mission.

At Yoco we create spaces to explore, we keep it simple, we stay connected to our customers and product and work towards mastering our craft. Joining our team provides valuable experience in your career as a Developer.

As part of the Yoco team, you will play a key role in the growth of the mobile Point of Sale opportunity in South Africa. To support this, we have built a role-based organisation where every individual is given the space to focus and develop their innate strengths.

Everyone at Yoco has the opportunity to lead a project and become a specialist, enabling flexibility, collaboration and accountability at all levels. And you will be working with a diverse, motivated and skilled team.
Join us on a meaningful journey at Yoco, and help enable our merchants to thrive through Open Commerce!

Yoco encourages applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply. Open positions at Yoco are competitive and we often receive high volumes of applicants. If you have not received further updates on your application after three weeks, you’re welcome to request feedback.

column2: >Yoco is an African technology company that builds tools and services to help small businesses get paid, run their business better, and grow. We believe that by opening up more possibilities for entrepreneurs to be successful, we can help create more jobs, enable people to thrive and help to drive our economy forward.

>Since our inception in 2014 we have operated in South Africa and have grown to serve over 120k small businesses. Our vision was never to be in only a single market, and we are now in an excellent position to execute our vision of helping small businesses in other parts of the continent, and world.
>We are looking for an engineering lead to help us pioneer our journey into new markets in 2021 and beyond and lay the technical foundation for our international expansion ambitions.

column1: • Champion the needs of our international customer base through customer empathy, iteration, and service ownership.
• Write clean, testable code, which will be a model for the team around you.
• Technically lead a diverse portfolio of full-stack engineering projects.
• Oversee the development and live operation of systems related to our journey into new markets.
<li>Grow the team by hiring exceptional talent, coaching and developing engineers, cultivating pragmatic engineering decision-making, and leveraging your technical &amp
column2: managerial expertise to constantly raise the bar.

column1: • Work with other leaders across multiple teams and departments to define the technical direction for the expansion business.
• Continuously develop relationships with product, engineering, expansion and other key stakeholders across teams and tribes.
• A desire to teach, improve, and otherwise force multiply the strengths of the engineers that surround you.
• At least 2 years experience managing and mentoring engineers (including providing feedback, investing in the career growth of your team members and growing teams).
• Experience designing and building full-stack applications in complex environments.
• High-level thinker, but also detail-oriented when executing on projects
• Emotional intelligence, empathy, and ability to establish trusting and strong relationships

column2: >Yoco is looking for a senior product manager to join our growth marketing team, as we innovate and develop the way we inform, educate and onboard small businesses across South Africa and beyond.

>We are seeking someone with a passion and depth of experience in solving problems and successful build and continuously improve our website and sign-up flows. Ideally, we imagine you should have a few solid years of product experience, preferably e-commerce or lead generation website product management.
>Define and drive the website and conversion (sign-up) product strategy and vision for the collection of products you manage and innovate.
>Build deep insights and empathy with your customers, identifying problems and opportunities to solve them.
>Manage the balance of aesthetic beauty and functional performance.
>Be the expert for your products, know your customers, competitors, and industry

>Evaluate the impact and revenue contribution of the products you manage.
>Lead, guide, and coach junior product managers to enable organisational growth and long-term success of the Yoco Product.

>Experience in product lifecycle management, preferably in e-Commerce or lead generation.

>Experience working with or managing cross-functional teams
>Able to identify and implement product experiments

>Experience within financial services or fintech is beneficial

column2: >Yoco is scaling up rapidly and focused on providing a better customer experience, even as we grow larger. In order to accomplish this we are looking for a Senior Salesforce Architect to design and implement a single CRM platform touching the entire customer journey and spanning all internal operations.

The ideal candidate is a go getter who wants to take their career forward in a dynamic environment and is driven to continually improve customer value and increase internal/external efficiency through leveraging your experiences and skills to drive the platform forward.

>This role will work closely with key team members including the technical leads, software engineer, business analysts and department leads. column1: Yoco is speaking directly to the SME segment, a significant contributor to GDP and the majority of employment. A segment typically misunderstood, at Yoco we are breaking ground by reaching, serving and syndicating these small businesses like never before. Insights covers three main facets in our context:
• Understanding the segments we want to reach (segments which have never been marketed to before)
• Analysing and understanding our base of 10 000 + businesses, which is growing by double digits and is on track to become the largest syndication of SMEs over the next 3 years
• Using this large base to communicate our grounded insights about SMEs to the market at large and become the authority in the space

column1: Working with cross-functional teams, you will be responsible for discovering, defining, and delivering products across Mobile and Web platforms in the payments, business services and Point-of-Sale (POS) space. column1:
1416621,899357,Lead Data Engineer,false,true,false,"

Yoco was launched in 2015 and is already supporting more than 30,000 SMEs! As Yoco keeps growing, so will its data. We are wanting a Lead Data Engineer to join our team who is comfortable building data infrastructure that scales exponentially year-on-year in terms of both volume and variety as more complex products are introduced into the ecosystem.

You will be working closely with software engineers and data scientists to enable the delivery of actionable insights in real time. This will include building internal products/tools, utilising open-source software to schedule data jobs, facilitate data flows and enable integration between the core Yoco system, the Yoco Data Warehouse and other cloud-based systems.

If you are passionate about building a world class, scalable data pipeline and warehouse then this is the role for you! Your work will be used to power the Yoco platform: by leveraging the rich data available, the Yoco Data Team is able to add real value to our customers and drive new product development, both internally and externally.

The requirement of being equally comfortable with managing databases and building out systems requires a dynamic individual capable of acquiring new skills at a rapid rate. You will be challenged constantly and required to find creative solutions to complex problems whilst leaning on recent developments in the SaaS space to cut out the majority of manual and repetitive work. Learning from international best practices, e.g. AirBnB, will provide a path to success - you should be familiar with the trends in the industry and their impact to any Data team.
<li>Make decisions around the infrastructure, layout and processes of the Yoco data warehouse, including:
• working with the engineering team on how to best track and record data
• following up on data inconsistencies to ensure that it is corrected
• transforming, standardising and collecting data from various sources
• collecting information from various sources to augment the business tables
• assisting with the optimisation of SQL queries from the Data and BI teams
• ensuring that the outputs from Data Science models are available and integrated into the system
• integrating, co-ordinating and maintaining data flows between various sources of data
• Managing and maintaining cloud service integrations that perform key data functions
• work towards replacing third-party elements of the data pipeline by using open-source tools
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• 5+ year’s experience in a similar role (e.g. database administrator, data infrastructure engineer)
• Experience in using Apache-Airflow or other data pipeline tools
• Familiarity with the structure of data required for reporting and data science projects
• Experience in leading a team of data scientists/engineers
• Amazon Web (Data) Services experience (Redshift, Spectrum, S3, Athena)
• Scala and/or JavaScript and/or Swift and/or React

1336397,867888,Outbound Sales Representative,false,true,false,"

The Outbound Sales Team and the whole Yoco company, in general, is experiencing rapid growth, and with all of this going on, we’ve got sales on the brain. Ok, who are we kidding? We always have sales on the brain. Over the last past few months, we have noticed a rapid interest of Yoco within the Cape Town Market… It is the Mother City after all.
The Outbound Sales Representatives will be expected to assist in crushing our monthly goals as well as their own personal Targets set out. So, what exactly will you do?

You will be expected to prospect super targeted leads based around specific accounts/markets/areas that have been identified as ideal customers. From there, the incumbent will manage their day around building meaningful relationships while prospecting and demonstrating our Yoco offering to interested businesses.

• Work directly with customers face to face and via telephone, and email to describe products and/or services in order to persuade potential and current customers to purchase new products and/or services.
• Educates customers on product offerings and services to improve their ""online presence"" and explains pricing and answers questions from customers building value in the customer relationship.
• Follows up with the customer via telephone or email following initial sales contact.
• Identifies customer issues and provides appropriate solutions via upsell of additional products and or services and obtains customer commitment and facilitates the delivery of the product.
• Complete basic Rates Negotiation with Merchants where required.
• Provide alternative solutions for integration possibilities and have the ability to discuss the usage and services listed of these products.
• Continued product education to better service customer calls.
• Maintains an accurate daily record of sales in sales tracker.
• Be a key “Brand” Associate and actively Network and find new business or potential clients.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• Three or more years’ experience of B2B sales in a high volume fast, paced environment.
• Strategical business understanding of the geographical and industrial market in the Western Cape.
• Previous experience and/or strong interest in outbound sales and prospecting.
• Good organisational skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritise in a high-volume, fast-paced environment.
• Solid understanding and experience of Web-Based Applications and CRM software.
• Ability to manage sensitive and critical client information.
• Need to have access to a vehicle for daily usage.
• Ability to work autonomously with fantastic Time Management Skills

VALUE PROPOSITION | WHY WORK FOR YOCO?
At Yoco we create spaces to explore, we keep it simple, we stay connected to our customers and product and work towards mastering our craft. Joining our team provides valuable experience in your career as a Copywriter.

As part of the Yoco team, you will play a key role in the growth of the mobile Point of Sale opportunity in South Africa. To support this, we have built a role-based organisation where every individual is given the space to focus and develop their innate strengths.

Everyone at Yoco has the opportunity to lead a project and become a specialist, enabling flexibility, collaboration and accountability at all levels. And you will be working with a diverse, motivated and skilled team.

Join us on a meaningful journey at Yoco, and help enable our merchants to thrive through Open Commerce!

Please note…
Yoco encourages applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply. Open positions at Yoco are competitive and we often receive high volumes of applicants. If you have not received further updates on your application after three weeks, you’re welcome to request feedback.

column2: >Yoco is a payments business at its core, we obsess about making payments as simple and delightful as possible. In our scale up stage, it is key to understand the payments user behaviour in order to diagnose, improve and optimise the payment experience. Alongside the core payments product, Yoco also offers Capital and other small business tools to make running a small business as easy as possible. The purpose of the role is to understand and improve the Yoco user’s experience across all digital platforms (app &amp
column3: web) for payments and adjacent products.

column2: >Build out the Product Insights capability at Yoco:

>At Yoco we build new great new products for merchants as quickly as possible by forming small autonomous, cross-functional pods capable of end to end delivery. Each pod includes a Product Manager, front and back-end engineers, QA and a product designer. From 2020 we are adding data analysts as a core skill that is required in each pod. The broader data analyst team embedded in pods will make up the new Product Insights team. As a senior in this space you will be leading analytical thinking in the Product Management space, coaching the data analysts in advanced analytics, and building out a team to scale this impact across all products.
>Creating a generalised, repeatable framework for analysing user behaviour in digital platforms:

>Key to the role is building a platform that enables rapid visual analysis by all stakeholders. This encompasses the entire framework from initial setup, standardising tagging within and across platforms, and metadata management, to front-end set up and user training.
>Supporting Product Managers to implement and rapidly iterate through the build, measure and learn loop:
>Ensure that data is a consideration throughout the software development lifecycle by partnering with Product Managers at the outset and feeding back to Engineering to ensure data quality.
>Define great metrics to align the team:

>Parse product objectives into measurable KPIs and perform the analysis, to not only measure success but also to provide insights into explaining user behaviour and proposing experiments to validate hypotheses.
>IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
>An experienced Data Analyst with a specific focus on product analytics, or
>A product manager with a strong analytical competency, looking to specialise in data analysis, or
>A generalist analytical thinker with a strong technical foundation (Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science or Actuarial Science) looking to apply familiar techniques to product analytics
>5+ years in an Data, Engineering or Product Management role
>Experience analysing and visualising event streams in web and app contexts
>Experience with experimentation, A/B testing and funnel building with large datasets
>Experience with event streams and mobile app measurement
>THE YOCO FORMULA - HOW WE CREATE VALUE
>The Yoco formula is a validated approach to work and a set of behaviours that create maximum value for our customers and help us grow.
>Core Values - Our way of working to create value &
>Leadership Principles - How we show up, engage &
>Say what you think and challenge me directly
>Don’t let ego get in the way

1449980,921085,Events Manager,false,true,false,"

Yoco is growing and so is our Brand Marketing team!
The Yoco Brand team is looking for a passionate, hyper-organised self-starter who can use eventing platforms to build our brand awareness in our target markets and help drive sales.

The ideal candidate must love the challenge of seeing an event through from start to finish, must enjoy working with multiple internal stakeholders and external partners, and also display strong business acumen in terms of understanding ROI of event activities and the importance of driving leads and business from our eventing investment.

This position has a broad scope, from identifying and organising our attendance at relevant industry trade shows, to building company conferences and meetups from the ground up, to ideating and executing full immersive brand experiential activations, all under the banner of an eventing strategy which needs to be built and owned by the incumbent.

• Define and build a well-articulated eventing strategy for Yoco, clearly pinpointing the role of events as a brand building and lead generation tool, and ensuring clear metrics and success measures are in place
• Working with the Sales, Growth and Brand Marketing teams to ensure objectives of all departments are met through the eventing channel
• Bring to life the concept of experiential eventing, ensuring we provide immersive experiences which break through, create buzz and bring our brand to life
• Provide project management of events from start to finish, from researching locations through to full event execution
<li>Lead, manage, and provide direction to contractors and vendors. Collaborate with internal staff, and external contractors to ensure successful event operations&nbsp
• Innovate by developing unique and differentiated activations at events that will bring our brand and product stories to life
• Develop strong product knowledge and be able to act as key product demonstrator at industry events and roadshows

• Analyze event performance and prepare reports on effectiveness based on ROI key performance indicators as well as Utilize project management tools such as milestone charts and timelines for all major event initiatives.
• Coordinate site visits and scheduling of events
<li>Start and grow a Yoco Events database for merchants and non-merchants to receive event communication and register to attend events&nbsp
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• 3-5 years relevant working experience in an events and project management environment
• Ability to manage multiple projects and work streams independently
• Fantastic customer service ethic and high expectations for quality
• Willingness to travel and work on weekends and evenings as needed to support above responsibilities (approx. 20%)
• Leadership skills to guide diverse teams towards a common goal.
• Knowledge and experience with marketing techniques, social media and industry trends
• Demonstrates extreme attention to detail and professionalism

Yoco is looking for a Product Manager to help enhance our product offering to Yoco merchants, specifically looking at our Point of Sale initially. The ideal candidate has extensive experience as a product manager for SME or small business solutions and has performed well previously in a rapidly changing and growing organization.
ROLE | WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING?
• Develop product strategy and roadmaps for features related to our Point of sale, and SME focused business solutions.
• Along with engineering leadership, develop appropriate planning, prioritization, and release management processes to enable us to launch new features across Android, iOS, and Desktop / Web.
• Drive superb execution against plan, anticipating staffing needs, risks, and the need for frequent and clear communication internally and with customers.
• Prioritize and design features for the thousands of customers who use Yoco to grow and manage their businesses every day.

2078935,1285372,Account Manager,false,true,false,"
Customer Centricity is the core of our DNA and everything we do is centered around our customers, the Key Account Management plays a very important role in fulfilling this commitment to our customers.

This role has helped us grow in building valuable partnerships and relationships with our customers, but most importantly it continues to give us guidelines in understanding, knowing and staying close to our customers.

As an Account Manager you will play an important role in continuing on building and maintaining profitable relationships within our merchant base. We are looking for someone to join our team who thinks differently about problems and values important relationships. This person will deliver value to the key accounts team by using their analytical skills to generate data to support informed decisions, draw on their creativity to support the business development team to build relevant and highly effective co-marketing programs.
This position is a 6 month fixed-term contract.
• You will be driving for highest levels of customer satisfaction and support by understanding challenges that are critical to customers and applying a solution-based approach.
• Provide a ""high-touch"" service through frequent visits and close contact with merchants.
• Onboard and train merchants and ensure a smooth handover process is adhered to at all times post-acquisition.
• Build and maintain customer networks and customer supplier networks to ensure effective relationships at an operational level.
• Proactively work with the Durban Area Lead Lead and other units within the organisation to retain and grow customer processing volumes and revenue and prevent client churn within your control.

• Establish effective internal relationships and processes with Supply Chain, Sales, Finance, Business Development and other units within the organisation to maintain superior customer service levels.

Execute customer pricing negotiations and profit-margins in line with merchant volume-value growth - dependent on customer base and profile but with exposure to and support of high profile customers to build capabilities.
Deliver on internal and external stakeholder requirements and service level agreements.
• Demonstrate innovative thinking in the area of expertise and translate this into business processes, solutions and working practice improvements.

• Implement and maintain a metric system as a reporting tool to ensure efficiency in measuring internal metrics and KPI's to drive the expected service delivery internally and externally to assist in the achievement of company objectives and goals.

• Identify new revenue and growth opportunities and refer to the Business Solutions Consultants team, Business Development, and cooperate with other strategic departments to up-sell our product offerings and value propositions.
• Perform other assigned duties based on business priorities and organisational needs.
• Attend work events where required for brand awareness and market activations.
• Actively promote and live up to the Yoco values and company culture.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• At least 3 years proven experience in an Account Management or Key Account Management position.
• A valid driver's license and own reliable vehicle.
• Willingness to travel is a must. This position requires both short and long distance trips for site visits as necessary.
• Excellent customer service, relationship development and consultative skills.
• Strong interpersonal and communication (written and verbal) skills over various channels.
• Proactive self-starter who can manage yourself independently and be highly organized with exceptional time management.
• Ability to manage administrative support and have strong attention to detail.
• Ability to learn quickly and become an expert in the company's product offering.
• Positive attitude and ability to work well under pressure.
• Have an obsession with processes and reporting and understand their importance in the growth of the company.
• Adaptable, loves challenges and ready to work in an ever-changing environment
• Desire and ability to work in a fast-paced environment and be part of a high performance team.

column7: >, our product that gives access to funding for merchants who use Yoco for payment. To date, we have helped more than 10,000 merchants grow their business by providing lending products through innovative risk modelling based on their Yoco card and online sales.&nbsp

column3: >This role is ideal for either a product manager with relevant financial experience, or a financial product manager who wants to make the move into tech, and lead the full user journey from commercial levers to building the user experience. It begins managing the commercial success of the product, and can evolve to be the PM of a cross functional team of developers, designers and analysts to evolve this and other financial products.&nbsp

>You will be responsible for the product and commercial success of Yoco Capital, ensuring Yoco grows access to funding for our merchant base while ensuring healthy metrics and merchant satisfaction.&nbsp
>Own the commercial relationship with our partners and funders
>Work with data and risk teams to grow the portfolio, refine loan offers to merchants and balance risk across the portfolio&nbsp
>Experiment with business levers such as loan repayment rate or pricing to grow conversion rates across different industries, and offer ranges&nbsp
>Review and be accountable for the commercial metrics such as loan disbursements, collection and default rates, to ensure the health of the portfolio&nbsp
>Coordinate with growth and marketing teams to set up automated marketing journeys and run campaigns that create awareness, increase conversion and leads for the capital sales team&nbsp
>Ensure close collaboration with the sales team lead, to ensure the lead pipeline is always full, service and support levels are managed and that merchant satisfaction remains high&nbsp
>Work closely with finance and partners to produce monthly reports to stakeholders on the health of the portfolio
>Identify, test and validate new opportunities and innovation in lending and financing, using qualitative and quantitative customer insights

>For the first 6 months you will own and move the commercial metrics, working with the data and risk teams to run experiments and grow the portfolio. After you have gained exposure on the partner and commercial side, you will be working with the engineering, design and UX team members recommending and driving product changes that make it simpler for merchants to apply and manage their cash advances. &nbsp

column2: >Yoco is growing quickly, and so is our data volume, variety and velocity. We are looking for an experienced and entrepreneurially minded individual who is excited to design and build out the next evolution of the Yoco Data Warehouse.
>This function is critical in increasing the speed of analysis and action taking at Yoco, enabling fast feedback loops to support agile decision making.

column1: <div>The role will be pivotal in the data space and you&rsquo

column1: <li><strong>Setting up a high performing data warehouse:&nbsp
column2: You will be setting up a new, scalable Business Intelligence warehouse at Yoco, using cutting edge cloud technology, with the ability to shape the future of analytics in a rapidly growing fintech company.

Key responsibilities are building robust ETL, reliable scheduling, and structuring a performant data warehouse to enable reporting and analysis across all business areas. Beyond simply preparing data you will be involved in design decisions, and supporting the business through detailed knowledge of the data.

You will be working closely with the Engineering and Data Science teams to manage and maintain the data pipeline end-to-end. You will be responsible for setting up and scheduling batch jobs to aggregate raw data into facts and dimensions and marts. You will also identify gaps, errors and inconsistencies in data tracking and work with Engineering to rectify these, you will need to understand the complete picture of all data within Yoco.

column1: IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• 5+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering (ETL, Scheduling, Optimisation)
• Strong communication skills, and an ability to work well with other teams
• Very fast learner and keen to get your hands dirty early on with experiments and hacks
• AWS stack- S3, Glue, Athena, Spectrum, Lambda
• Experience with data tracking tools: Segment, Stitch

• Knowledge of payments and the mobile Point of Sale space
• Experience with CRM tools (e.g. Salesforce)

column1: Customer Centricity is the core of our DNA and everything we do is centered around our customers, the Key Accounts Role plays a very important role in fulfilling this commitment to our customers.

column1: Our Operations Team is looking for a process orientated individual who enjoys working with people and has their hearts set on improving the Merchant Onboarding experience to join our team on a 6-month, half-day contract position.
This role requires you to be a champion multitasker!

You will work with members from the broader Yoco team and be responsible for the day-to-day operations of merchant settlements at Yoco. This involves managing and sending out communications regarding merchants bank details and payouts.

This is a great opportunity for the junior candidate wanting to gain work experience. If you have a love of organising and enjoy putting aspects into place from beginning to end and maintaining that process - This is for you.
<li>Work with a close-knit and energetic Operations team for an ever-growing start-up.&nbsp
• Make a difference to the South African economy by providing businesses with the tools and support to grow their businesses whilst providing support to an eco-system of entrepreneurs.

• Gain commercial experience and skills in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

column1: <div>Yoco encourages applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply. Open positions at Yoco are competitive and we often receive high volumes of applicants. If you have not received further updates on your application after three weeks, you&rsquo

Yoco is an African technology company that builds tools and services to help small businesses get paid, run their business better, and grow. We believe that by opening up more possibilities for entrepreneurs to be successful, we can help create more jobs, enable people to thrive and help to drive our economy forward.
The role of growth engineering is to help us connect with businesses and bring them into our rapidly growing community of customers.
column2: To do this we need to deliver engaging frontend experiences that connect with our customers. The Growth Engineering team enables and accelerates the rapid expansion of Yoco. They are the tip of the spear and the heralds of innovation.

column1: Frontend Engineers at Yoco build and own innovative web sites and applications using advanced JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, with a desire to achieve exceptional design fidelity, usability, accessibility, and performance across both desktop and mobile. They understand that the internet in Africa varies widely in speed and as such understand the importance of developing a progressive experience that will be accessible for to all.
The cadence is fast, the expectations are insane, the excitement is unparalleled because ultimately we want to change the world, not tomorrow, but today.
• Work closely with our world class Growth Marketing and Design teams to implement experiences that grow the Yoco customer base.
<li>Occasionally other engineers on the team architect and implement the tools and infrastructure which power Yoco&rsquo
• Move fast, be creative, and learn from everyone around you.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• Have 5+ years of experience building public-facing websites which work elegantly across commonly used browsers
• Are good with JavaScript, CSS, HTML and have a passion for front end frameworks like React and Angular.
• Are able to achieve great results with designers but are not afraid to deliver visuals independently.
• Have experience with web asset optimisation and content delivery networks.
• Get excited about seeing numbers that are moving up and to the right.

column2: >Yoco is a FinTech company. We focus on building tools and services to help small and micro businesses get paid, run better, and grow. We believe in unlocking entrepreneurial potential anywhere, in empowering people to thrive and in driving our economy forward.

>Yoco was founded in 2013. Today we are a company of over 150 people all driven by a common goal: keeping the needs of our customers at heart.  Our vision is Open Commerce and we want to do this to enable people to thrive.

>If you are passionate about building and maintaining a world class, scalable data pipeline and warehouse then this is the role for you! Your work will be used to power the Yoco platform: by leveraging the rich data available, the Yoco Data Team is able to add real value to our customers and drive new product development, both internally and externally.

>The requirement of being equally comfortable with managing databases and building out systems requires a dynamic individual capable of acquiring new skills at a rapid rate. You will be challenged constantly and required to find creative solutions to complex problems whilst leaning on recent developments to cut out the majority of manual and repetitive work. Learning from industry proven best practices will provide a path to success - you should be familiar with the trends in the industry and their impact to any Data Team.

column3: >Maintain and scale our cloud based data warehouse to continually process immense amounts of high quality data with micro-second response times for reporting, analytics and customer applications
>Build and maintain data pipelines from cloud based relational databases as well as in the future event-streams and non-relational databases
>Manage and maintain cloud service integrations that perform key data functions as well as integrate disparate data sources to create a single consolidated view
>Continually plan, document and execute system expansion and architecture recommendations to support the organisations growing data and analytical needs
>Work cross-functionally and collaborate with various stakeholders to ensure their data needs are being met in a timely fashion
>Continue to establish a DataOps feel within the team and ensure data engineering best practices are closely followed at all times
>Perform technical interviews, mentor team members and continually drive innovation within the team by nurturing a willingness to experiment and tackle complex problems together
>Deliver high quality, maintainable and performant code as well as constantly improve and teach standards for best practices
>Scope the objectives and long-range goals of your team to align with the greater organisational  key objectives and deliver on these in a timely fashion

column2: >IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?

column1: • 5+ years experience in a similar role deploying production quality code (e.g. software engineer, data infrastructure engineer)
• Have 3+ years experience leading a team of expert Data or Software Engineers
• Are transparent, articulate and driven to succeed
• Professional experience using Python for data processing
• Deep understanding of SQL, PostgreSQL and analytical data warehouses (Redshift preferred)
• Experience deploying applications to cloud environments and familiarity with CI/CD tooling
• Production experience in using Apache-Airflow or other data pipeline tools
• Hands-on experience implementing ETL (or ELT) best practices at scale
• Experience with 3rd party data sources and consuming data from SaaS application APIs
• Improve, manage, and teach standards for code maintainability and performance in code submitted and reviewed
• Committed to continually keeping up with the advancements in data engineering
• Great communicator able to collaborate with various stakeholders throughout the organisation
• Have working knowledge of Terraform and Kubernetes
• Familiarity with the structure of data required for reporting and data science projects
• Amazon Web (Data) Services experience (Redshift, Spectrum, S3, Athena)
• Scala and/or JavaScript and/or Swift and/or React

column1: Yoco is looking for a Scrum Master to guide our growing team of Software Engineers on their journey to become a strong and productive team of agile developers. In doing so, we aim to increase collaboration, efficiency, transparency, delivery, and innovation.

In this role, you will be a Scrum and Agile evangelist, and will empower our teams to apply the right methodologies, practices, and tools, to enable them to thrive. By applying the agile principles and values, as well as bringing your own ideas, you will play a key role in our engineering team.
Together with the team, you’ll be part of building the tools that thousands of businesses use to serve their customers every day.
• Guide the team and wider organisation on how to use Agile/Scrum practices and values to delight customers and deliver value on a consistent basis.
• Facilitate and lead the continued implementation of Scrum at Yoco
• Build a trusting and safe environment where problems can be raised without fear of blame, retribution, or being judged, with an emphasis on problem-solving.
• Facilitating discussion, decision making, and conflict resolution.
• Facilitating getting the work done without coercion, assigning, or dictating the work.
• Strong ability to share knowledge and support the Product Owner on tasks such as grooming and maintaining the product backlog.
• Encourage the team to continuously improve and master their craft.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• At least 2 - 3 years of Agile Lead experience within a software development team.
• Bachelors degree or Diploma in a relevant field.
• First level Scrum Master certification (CSM, PSM I).
• Good skills and knowledge of servant leadership, facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, empowerment, and increasing transparency.

• Knowledge of numerous well-documented patterns and techniques for filling in the intentional gaps left in the Scrum approach (example: numerous Burndown techniques, numerous Retrospective formats, handling bugs, etc.).
• Second level Scrum Master certification (CSP, PSM II, etc.).
• Experience playing the Scrum Master role for at least three years for a software development team that was diligently applying Scrum principles, practices, and theory.
• Knowledge of other Agile approaches: XP, Kanban, TDD, etc.
• Familiar with modern estimation techniques and trends.
• Knowledge and/or experience with widely successful Agile techniques: User Stories, TDD, Continuous Integration, Continuous Testing, Pairing, Automated Testing, Agile Games
• Experience running a variety of unique and fun retrospective formats.
• Ideally you will have actively engaged in the agile community (Meetups, conferences, etc.).

column1: In our team at Yoco and the way we work, we find our core ability to differentiate against the well-resourced and incumbent competition. Our team needs to stay in high-performance shape as the venture rapidly scales. We are looking for a forward-looking candidate, who combines strong conceptual thinking with excellent execution, staying ahead of the curve with the latest organisational development practices.

This position is ideal for you have at least five years plus of experience. Never a dull day at the office, you will employ psychological principles and research methods to solve problems in the workplace and improve the quality of life.

<div><span class="" author-d-16z86ztz122z98z81zz82zz85zunv3z82zpqfnlamlz122zxpz88zz88z4xqcz79z3xz77zz77z7z65zgz67zz90zz86zz65zz70zpoz83z"">You have a natural ability to combine a scientific and human-centric approach to organisation development. column1: IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING?

• Collaborating with recruiting and talent management to develop and improve interview techniques, implement psychometric testing and skills rating that would determine the interests and abilities of an employee under consideration for employment or promotion.
• Analyse job requirements and content to establish criteria for classification, selection, training, and other related personnel functions.
• Working with the management team on organisation design, structure and future planning. Facilitating organisational development and change management.
• Assisting with role and resource planning for teams.
• Overall tracking of organisation, team and individual performance against firm objectives. Driving management by output culture and helping to implement systems /mechanisms to support.
• Facilitation of group interaction and planning sessions during quarterly, monthly and bi-weekly sprint sessions. Improving relationships with colleagues through intra/inter-team development
• Remaining up-to-date on organisational development topics by reading current research literature and how to apply the new knowledge to the workplace.
• On top of cultural dynamics within the team, going a level deep into understanding the various demographics within the firm and subsequent nuances
• Ongoing research studies of the physical work environment, organisational structures, communication systems, group interactions, morale, and motivation to assess organisational functioning
• Formulate and implement training programs, applying principles of learning and individual differences.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• At least 5 years + experience in the field
• Qualifications: Masters Degree + in the field
• Experience in job profiling and job evaluation
• Strong communication skills to disseminate ideas and drive adoption
• Ability to solve complex people problems, make decisions and provide advice and consultation when needed
• Knowledge of sociology and anthropology in order to understand group behavior and dynamics, their history or culture and any other relevant information for the job
• Worked in a technology venture and startup (bonus)

>Yoco is a FinTech company. We focus on building tools and services to help small and micro businesses get paid, run better, and grow. We believe in unlocking entrepreneurial potential anywhere, in empowering people to thrive and in driving our economy forward.

>Yoco was founded in 2013. Today we are a company of over 100 people all driven by a common goal: keeping the needs of our customers at heart. Our vision is Open Commerce and we want to do this to enable people to thrive.

>The DevOps team allows Yoco to create new customer value fast. This is the team that lays and protects the foundation so that we can build amazing things quickly and securely. They also ensure that, once deployed, our systems are stable, and scale effectively.

1616481,1023799,Lead QA Automation Engineer,false,true,false,"

Yoco is looking for a Lead QA Automation Engineer to join our team of technical professionals in creating quality software for SME’s across South Africa and beyond.

The ideal candidate is an eager individual who is wanting to take their career forward, is driven to continually improve customer value and increase internal efficiency through quality, innovative software.

As the Lead QA Automation Engineer, you will spearhead part of the wider team that is responsible for the quality, development, integration and maintenance of Yoco’s range of internal and merchant/customer facing software.
• Take ownership of Yoco’s long-term vision and strategy for QA and Test Automation.
• Pioneer the work of QA automation within the Yoco engineering team.
• Proactively look for opportunities to introduce and entwine testing automation and quality into the product development process.
• Build and maintain the framework in which the rest of your team will implement automated tests using a combination of Selenium and/or other frameworks.
• Extract test requirements from high-level product specifications and workshops.
• Research and demonstrate new QA technologies, and be able to motivate for their adoption at Yoco if the benefits are worth it.
• Continue to advocate for testing as an integral part of the development process at Yoco.
• Advocate for excellence and quality within cross-functional development teams, and across the wider business.
• Actively coach developers and QA engineers on test automation best practices.
• Continuously improve automated test coverage and UI functional test coverage.
• Contribute to and improve our test frameworks and services.
• Train and mentor other QA’s in the team.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• At least 8 years’ experience in commercial Software Testing and Test methodologies.
• At least 3 years’ experience in an Automation Testing lead role required.
• Ability to understand basic coding and write basic scripts.
• Expert knowledge of all different levels or layers of testing (including UI, API, Unit, regression, integration, system, and others).
• Experience in writing, executing and monitoring manual and automated test suites across a variety of web technologies including, but not limited to, HTML, JavaScript, and Typescript.
• Comfortable working across web, Android, and iOS
• Exceptional attention to detail with proven interpersonal skills
• Logical approach with a passion for problem-solving
• Strong ability to manage pressure and deadlines effectively
• Have shown an ability to advocate for quality across different teams
• Experience within agile environments and understand what it means to have a quality mindset in an agile environment
• Can convince others (and rally them around the idea of) why agile software teams should have a dedicated QA role
• Financial Services/payments system testing exposure - highly advantageous

column2: >Yoco's Engineering team is looking for a highly motivated and adaptable individual to amplify and support our Chief Technology Officer (CTO) and ultimately the broader engineering and product delivery team.As Chief of Staff to the CTO:

column1: • You'll be expected to float back and forth between strategic and tactical focuses, supporting efforts from annual planning all the way down to team execution on organisation-wide priorities.
• You’ll be given authority to drive key cross-cutting endeavours to continually level-up the engineering organisation.
• You’ll play an instrumental role in scaling the engineering organisation and helping us double the number of engineers this year.
• Unlocking/multiplying the work of the CTO and scaling the impact of the role.
• Be involved in the innovative work that Yoco is doing to change the landscape of small business payments in South Africa and beyond.

• You’ll drive key Tech organisation-wide projects, aiming at taking the engineering organization to scale and operate more efficiently: our Tech Delivery Capacity program and also our (about to start!) Humans in Tech program as well (better attracting and retaining makers).
• You will lead relevant meetings, coordinate relevant stakeholders contributing to your projects and follow-up on action plans and results.
• You will have a keen pulse for the engineering team and use this to propose new initiatives that will improve the overall health and happiness of the engineering team.
• Support the Tech Management team governance: you’ll run weekly Engineering Forum team meetings, ensure communication of the key decisions and follow-up on actions

• Lead cross-cutting missions such as tech vision definition, follow-up and updates: you will organise work sessions, offsites and any kind of efforts for the Tech management team to improve its skills and the way of working together.

• Provide a bridge for smooth communication between the CTO and other executives and functional areas (Product, People, Marketing, Finance, Customer Relations and Legal) across Yoco, enabling effective cross-functional collaboration across the company.
• Provide decision support through research, analysis of information, and clear presentation of considerations.
3/ Key contribution to Tech Executive Communications
• Act as a trusted advisor and operator for the CTO, who can fill in as necessary in meetings, synthesizing information and feedback for quick decision-making

• Prepare memos, presentations, and emails for internal and external audiences. This involves setting the agenda for engineering all-hands meetings, internal keynotes, helping draft presentations to the executive team and board.
• Stay up-to-date with the Tech economy and community and leverage your knowledge in a Yoco context to sustain the businesses Tech ambitions.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

• The right candidate will have interacted with and managed significant engineering teams, set strategy and experienced technical organisations scaling. 7+ years of overall software development lifecycle experience or product management experience.
• Cross-functional project experience, working with many stakeholders across departments.
• Has managed engineering teams and/or geographically distributed projects
• Be comfortable working with executives and senior leaders, be proficient at running executive meetings
• Structured approach to decision making, but with a strong bias towards action and speed
• High-level thinker, but also detail-oriented when executing on projects
• Emotional intelligence, empathy, and ability to establish trusting and strong relationships
• Strong oral and written communication skills and ability to influence others
• Flexible and able to shift their focus based on the needs of the CTO and the business.

column1: We are a team of Software Engineers and Product professionals who have effective relationships with many satisfied customers. We are committed to understanding the FinTech sector and improving payment processes for SMB’s.

We are wanting a collaborative and skilled Senior Software Engineer who is who is able to elevate our outputs and contribute to our mission, who is passionate about customers, delivering high-quality products, building robust solutions and can be both a technical champion and a mentor to a medium-sized team of like-minded individuals.

We’re a diverse and zealous team, committed to constructing some of the world's leading finance technology products, while providing an unparalleled experience to our customers. If you're passionate about adding new value to a robust team and diverse group of customers, have a love for all things tech and wanting to learn and be challenged, we are the company to join.
• Writing code for our mobile and web applications using React, NodeJS, React Native and Redux (with some gentle sprinkles of Objective C and Java as required).
• Building APIs and services on our back-end using Scala and PostgreSQL.
• You will help decide and plan which features we will build, and how they are architected and implemented.
• Build features and products that are easy to use and help our customers grow their businesses.
• Able to mentor and share knowledge with junior Software Engineers.
• You will work closely with your team, which includes other Software Engineers, Product Manager(s), our design and UX minds as well as members of the broader Yoco Team.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• You are happy writing both back-end code and doing some front-end work on Web and Mobile applications.
• You can take a feature or product all the way from conception to release.
• You are willing to work with and guide junior developers to help you deliver solutions.
• You enjoy using and are not afraid to learn new and exciting technologies.
• You are excellent at solving complicated problems, understanding real-world issues and delivering high-quality software.
• You can deliver stable yet flexible software that allows us to iterate quickly to deliver features.
• You build re-usable solutions that others can use to avoid re-inventing the wheel every time.
• 6+ years as a professional software engineer.
• Experience with both back-end and front-end development.
• BSc Computer Science or equivalent is highly encouraged.
• Experience with Scala or another functional language.
• Experience leading teams, designing and architecting products, working with customers all a plus.

2955008,1739664,DevOps Engineer,false,true,false,"
Yoco is a FinTech company. We focus on building tools and services to help small and micro businesses get paid, run better, and grow. We believe in unlocking entrepreneurial potential anywhere, in empowering people to thrive and in driving our economy forward.

Yoco was founded in 2013. Today we are a company of over 150 people all driven by a common goal: keeping the needs of our customers at heart. Our vision is Open Commerce and we want to do this to enable people to thrive.

The DevOps team allows Yoco to create new customer value fast. This is the team that lays and protects the foundation so that we can build amazing things quickly and securely. They also ensure that, once deployed, our systems are stable, and scale effectively.

column3: >Keep our systems running - assist with troubleshooting and debugging of performance problems and architecture bottlenecks.
>Assist with the design and deployment of systems infrastructure for installing secure, highly available software at scale.
>Work alongside a broader team of world-class engineers, sharing knowledge and collaborating on various projects.
>Automate common functionality to empower various departments to manage their infrastructure needs independently.
>Implement, monitor and scale systems that support large amounts of data and requests with a very high percentage of availability.
>Work cross-functionally to understand the requirements for architecting infrastructure according to scale and high volumes of data.
>Maintain and improve our various systems and infrastructure such as CI/CD, monitoring, logging and tracing.
>Continue to establish and refine our best practices for security, monitoring, migration and expansion of business systems infrastructure.

column1: IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?

column3: >At least 2+ years production level experience in building and maintaining public cloud-based infrastructure, preferably AWS.
>Have hands-on production level experience deploying software in a service-based and event-driven architecture.
>Self-directed in debugging issues, identifying faults and enhancing logging of software.
>Are experienced in IT infrastructure and systems security, cloud or network systems management, and business continuity.
>Have working knowledge of infrastructure-as-code tooling, configuration management and container orchestration software. Terraform, Ansible, Puppet and Kubernetes preferred.
>Are experienced in writing code in languages such as Python, Ruby, Go etc.
>Work collaboratively across the entire organisation on various projects.
>Are transparent, articulate and driven to succeed.
>Have a passion for enabling teams of software engineers.

re looking for a top-performing, ambitious individual to join our expansion team as business development manager for Rwanda.

column2: We are preparing our market entry, which means that from day one, you&rsquo
column3: ll be given the opportunity to drive innovation and execute strategies that will take Yoco into the first new market outside South Africa. This will give you unprecedented growth opportunities in one of the fastest growing fintech startups in Africa. You&rsquo
column4: ll experience a cycle of learning, succeeding, falling down, getting up, and going back for more.

column2: ROLE | WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?

The Business Development team plays a key role in our growth and has the responsibility of acquiring merchants directly and by creating partnerships with leading channels and service providers with the objective of acquiring our first thousands of merchants (Yes, we are ambitious), creating new revenue opportunities, and making Yoco the best product that entrepreneurs use to run and grow their business in Rwanda.

As a Business Development Representative in Rwanda will work alongside the expansion team and other teams in our HQ in order to create meaningful partnerships that accelerate growth or enhance the product experience for our merchants.

We are looking for someone to join our team who thinks differently about problems, values important relationships and has great entrepreneurial spirit. You should be as comfortable showing up to a market and demoing our product, pitching and negotiating deals with partners as working cross-functionally with colleagues in Product, Sales, Operations, Finance, Marketing, People and Data &amp
column3: Risk to create new experiences that meet the strategic objectives of partners and Yoco. This person will deliver value to the business development team by defining and executing the strategies and tactics of the Business Development approach for Rwanda.

2918111,1721470,Senior Backend Engineer,false,true,true,"
Help us build the future of commerce and empower small businesses to grow.

Are you a back end developer looking for your next challenge? Would you like to join a team of passionate, talented developers ready to build next-generation mobile and web applications to empower the small businesses of tomorrow? Then keep reading.

Yoco is an African technology company that builds tools and services to help small businesses get paid, run their business better, and grow. We believe that by opening up more possibilities for entrepreneurs to be successful, we can help create more jobs, enable people to thrive and help to drive our economy forward.

We’re looking for an experienced backend (or full-stack!) developer to join the Yoco team in building out and scaling our backend services. These services include everything from delivery logistics to fraud and risk management systems.
Great. Broadly speaking, what does this role involve?
• Work on the back-end systems that power the Yoco app and web for thousands of small businesses.
• Help us automate and improve our systems and processes to make sure the Yoco experience is as fast, easy and reliable as possible.
• Contribute to the evolution of our system architecture and help drive our evolution towards micro-services.
• Do the hard and complicated to make it easier and simple.
You may be a fit for this role if:
• You have 4+ years experience as a professional Software Engineer
• You have strong experience writing back end systems and APIs
• You enjoy learning new technologies and programming languages (We primarily use Scala and Python for our back end services but are open to candidates with experience in other languages)
• You are passionate about building robust and scalable solutions
• BSc Computer Science or equivalent is encouraged (strong work experience can fill this gap)
Okay, now I'm really intrigued. What are you looking for in the the ideal candidate?
• You have 2+ years as a professional Software Engineer.
• You preferably have experience with React (and maybe even React Native) - we're open to experience in other modern Javascript frameworks.
• You are passionate about delivering high quality and beautiful products that are amazing for users.
• You build re-usable solutions that others can use to avoid re-inventing the wheel every time.
• Bonus points for any native mobile experience, or backend development experience.
Tell me more about Yoco's employee culture. What's it like working with you?
The Yoco Formula is our approach to how we work, as well as a set of behaviours that inspire us to create the best solutions for our customers.
• Say what you think and challenge me directly
• Don’t let ego get in the way
The result? Flexibility, agility, collaboration and accountability at all levels. You'll join a diverse, motivated and super skilled team. And you'll be motivated to grow as an individual to keep up.
<div>To see it for yourself, have a look at our&nbsp
column2: Exposure Gallery. Photographer and Visual Anthropologist Gregor Röhrig has documented our journey in the form of beautiful photo-stories.

column1: We're changing the world one small business at a time. Join us.

column1: You will be examining current business process by evaluating the data generated, identifying issues and proposing solutions to increase efficiencies, enhance scaling capabilities and educate domain teams around the implications of their current actions. • Test for causation rather than simply correlation
• Use statistical and machine learning models to forecast future outcomes

column4: In Finance at Yoco, you will work across the company to ensure that Yoco takes sound financial decisions by providing financial leadership and analytical support.&nbsp
column5: You will take on an important role in managing all aspects of revenue accounting. This is a key role, in one of the continents leading FinTech startups with significant potential for personal growth.

column2: >Manage the accounting for multiple revenue streams as well as implementing and monitoring internal controls.
>Maintain the validity, accuracy and completeness for revenue and inventory accounting.
>Perform bank reconciliations, accounts receivable reconciliations and oversee collection processes.
>Track and report on key business metrics and complete month end reporting.
>Provide financial insight on margin, revenue recognition and inventory performance.
>Cross team collaboration to help drive performance and act as a trusted finance business partner within the business.
>Participate in crucial accounting projects, implementation of new system logics or enhancements, new revenue accounting standards and support new product launches.
>Work on automation projects to improve the speed and efficiency of the monthly revenue close.
>Draft accounting requirements for the Engineering teams, user acceptance testing, and strengthening of change management controls.
>Working with large sets of data and extracting valuable information about the company's revenue that management can use to make business decision.
>Matching revenues with expenses and track product and service revenue for various business segments.
>Brainstorm potential ways to increase revenue without an accompanying increase in expenses.&nbsp
>IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
>CA(SA)/CIMA/ACCA or other relevant financial management qualifications.
>Experience in working with large sets of data.
>Self-starter with a strong sense of ownership and comfortable working in an entrepreneurial environment.
>Practical understanding of accounting standards and principles.
>High attention to detail and results focus.
>Experience with drafting business requirements and collaborating with Engineering teams on internal accounting systems.
>Advanced Microsoft Excel skills, with the ability to manipulate and digest mass amounts of data.
>Understanding of the South African regulatory and business environment.
>Have a desire to implement and improve financial controls.
>Must have a passion for accurate and complete financial reporting.
>Willingness to experiment with new software tools to improve financial reporting process.
>Ability to prioritise and communicate with senior team members.
>Ability to work independently with limited supervision.
>Experience in banking, payments or financial services.

You will play a valuable role in creating, leading and caring for the Yoco brand personality and tone through your chosen craft of storytelling and copywriting. It will be your responsibility to care deeply about the words that represent our brand and, in doing so, will introduce your copy governance principles and practices. We have many exciting stories to tell, as do our wonderful merchants that use our payment platform, products and systems. Your job will be to find those stories and produce them with your colleagues. This will require you to collaborate tightly across diverse teams, cities and functions. You will need to think about introducing the right style guides, tools and processes to ensure our communication (across many different channels, formats and cities) remains coherent and true to the Yoco brand.
• Craft brand personality, tone, naming conventions
• Copy governance (ensure high-quality stories, scripts, posts, campaigns and blog/journalism contributions)
• Work with cross-functional teams on ideation and marketing campaign concepts
• Producing copy and scripts for all marketing initiatives (acquisition copy as well as long form)
• Help create a communication hierarchy across key customer segments and experiences
• Support colleagues to ensure brand story coherency and conversion metrics
• Work with UX designers to produce copy for in-app experiences (on-boarding, workflows)
• Work with product teams to translate features into compelling customer facing propositions

>Customer centricity is at the core of everything Yoco does and as a Customer Engagement Lead you will be responsible for providing a productive and motivating working environment to a team of Customer Engagement Representatives to ensure they&rsquo
column3: re giving the best customer support possible to our Yoco merchants.

column2: >Your most important role will be to build and lead a strong team in their development to accomplish desired results that will help our merchants to grow and run their business.

>We expect our Customer Engagement Lead will commit to excellent service standards, maintain high customer satisfaction and lead by example by upholding the Yoco values and leadership principles.&nbsp

>Our ideal candidate is someone who loves working with people, has a passion for helping others and creating amazing customer experiences. Someone who is patient, empathetic, and passionately communicative with our merchants, and can lead alongside a team is exactly who we are looking for!

column3: >Lead by creating a productive, motivational and prosperous working environment for the Customer Engagement team through active encouragement and empowerment.&nbsp
>Exemplify inclusive leadership attributes through openness, transparency and trust to enable the Customer Engagement team to thrive.&nbsp
>Be responsible for the mentorship and development of our Customer Engagement Representatives.
>Develop, innovate and implement customer support procedures, policies and standards.
>Design and set goals and targets for the Customer Engagement Team.&nbsp
>Drive productivity in alignment with both the team and wider organisational goals.
>Plan and monitor daily activities within Customer Engagement operations.
>Analyse customer support metrics and compile accurate feedback reports to the business.
>Keep the unit running in an efficient and profitable manner, to increase customer satisfaction, expectations and retention.&nbsp
>Handle escalated customer complaints by providing appropriate solutions and alternatives within the service level agreement and follow up to ensure resolution.&nbsp
>Work with stakeholders to own the recruitment and growth of the Customer Engagement Team.
>Build sustainable relationships rooted in trust through open and interactive communication with Yoco customers.&nbsp
>Lead by example in going the extra mile to engage with customers and fellow colleagues.&nbsp
>Perform other assigned duties based on business priorities and organisational needs
>Stay informed on the latest industry techniques and methods.
>Actively promote and live up to the Yoco values and company culture.&nbsp
>Strategise on solutions aimed at handling Yoco&rsquo
