column3: >Yoco is a FinTech company. We focus on building tools and services to help small and micro businesses get paid, run better, and grow. We believe in unlocking entrepreneurial potential anywhere, empowering people to thrive and driving our economy forward.

>We are looking for a data-driven, structured, analytical thinker to help us drive actionable insights, build out the data capabilities in the finance space, improve the quality of data, accuracy of reporting, and automate repeatable tasks. This role involves a great deal of multitasking and cross-collaboration across a wide variety of teams.
>We have embraced a remote work culture, so you’re welcome to apply from anywhere in South Africa.

column2: >IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING?
>Improve the quality of data and integrations

column3: >The finance team relies heavily on data from the data warehouse for reporting and analytics. It’s vital to the understanding of the business and is used in every step of the decision-making process. Understanding the nuances of the core transactional system, the reporting platforms, and the finance platform (Xero), as well as the integration points between these systems, will be key in driving changes in process and implementations back into source systems, as well as continually improving and updating the data warehouse.
>The finance team has a number of manual tasks that can be automated, freeing the team up to focus on more strategic initiatives, and reducing the time spent on monthly/quarterly/yearly reporting.

>The drive for self-service data in the finance space also means setting up vetted, approved and documented data sets that will enable the finance team to navigate through the complex data having the underlying complexities and data-cleansing abstracted away.
>Decisions at every level rely heavily on the input and analytics from the data team. Providing support and direction, and communicating and making recommendations based on these findings.

>Many of the company-level performance metrics are either reported through finance or added to the financial reporting packs. Ensuring that these metrics are well defined, highly available and trustworthy is critical in this space.
>An experienced Data Analyst or Business Intelligence Analyst with a specific focus on financial reporting

>Experience in working in either a growth-focused or technology organisation, ideally working together and collaborating with the finance team, data team, and engineering team, as well as other business stakeholders
>Comfortable with a variety of Data Analytics tools and platforms from cloud platform databases (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery) with SQL, Python, and front-end tools e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Looker

>A generalist analytical thinker with a strong financial foundation (understanding of income statements, balance sheets, reporting cycles) and preferably a knowledge of Xero, or other financial platforms
>5+ years in a Data or Finance Reporting role
>Strong experience with financial reporting and custom reporting on platforms such as Xero, Sage, Dynamics
>Experience working with engineers, finance team, and data to solve complex problems

>Yoco is an African Payments company with the vision to help small businesses across the continent and the world better run and grow their business. We are at a key inflection point in our journey: We have just crossed 80.000 merchants in South Africa and are now in an excellent position to execute our vision of expanding our offering to more markets outside of South Africa. To help us achieve that vision, we are looking for a motivated and driven associate to join our expansion team to shape and drive our growth strategy and ambitions outside of South Africa.&nbsp

>The Expansion Associate will work closely with the Head of Expansion and the Yoco founders to design, shape and execute this crucial part of the Yoco journey going forward. You will play a key role in supporting our expansion all the way from formulating strategy to driving execution and supporting market launches and operations.

column1: <div><span class="" author-d-iz88z86z86za0dz67zz78zz78zz74zz68zjz80zz71z9iz90za3z122z3xtavtviz71zz70ztlz79zgc6d27dez90z6yz90zm7z72z"">Payments is one of the largest untapped opportunities in South Africa. There are over 500,000 small businesses in South Africa that struggle to accept cards. Yoco makes it possible for any business in South Africa, no matter their size or setup, to accept card payments.&nbsp
To do this, Yoco has changed the rules of the game. By transforming the ever so dull payment experience, making it smarter, simpler and delightful.

Smarter: Traditional card terminals are fixed, clunky and do little except process a payment and issue a paper receipt. Yoco offers an integrated cash register and card terminal that runs on your smartphone or tablet. Transforming a once disjointed experience to a more seamless, digital and mobile experience.
Simpler: Getting a card terminal from a bank. A once cumbersome, manual process that took weeks if not months, has now been reduced to a 1-step process that takes minutes.

Delightful: We've redesigned the card payment experience with both the merchant and customer in mind. The receipt is now paperless, the check-out time faster, the cash-up painless, sales tracking more accurate and more useful. With a goal of giving small businesses more time to deliver their great products and services, and customers more time to enjoy the goods they just purchased.

column1: • Being a highly technical, hands-on and effective manager for a team of 4 - 6 engineers
• Writing code for our mobile and web applications using React, NodeJS, React Native and Redux (with some gentle sprinkles of Objective C and Java as required).
• Building APIs and services on our back-end using Scala and PostgreSQL.
• Developing and managing a team of talented Engineers, including task planning and code reviews.
• Supporting and leading others who are doing the same.
• Working with our Product Management(s) as well as our design and UX minds to ensure that we deliver continuous value to our growing base of customers.
• Doing the hard and complicated to make it easier and simple.
• Be an active participant in the decision-making and planning of new features we will build, and how they are architected and implemented.
• Drive and lead the release and QA cycles of the teams code.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• You are happy writing both back-end code and doing some front-end work on Web and Mobile applications.
• Feeling a sense of excitement when offering input and contributing to the broader product discussion.
• Proven ability in taking a feature or product all the way from conception to completion and release.
• You feel empowered by learning new things and using modern technology.
• You are excellent at solving complicated problems, understanding real-world issues and delivering high-performance software.
• You can deliver stable yet flexible software that allows us to iterate quickly in order to deliver features.
• You build re-usable solutions that others can use to avoid re-inventing the wheel every time.
• 6 - 8 years as a professional Software Engineer
• BSc Computer Science or equivalent is highly encouraged
• Experience with both back-end and front-end development
• A clear, real passion for software engineering
• Demonstrated ability to recruit and lead technical teams, including performance management
• Strong ability to work independently while still being collaborative and inclusive
• Experience in Java, Scala, Kotlin or any other JVM language
• Experience leading teams, designing and architecting products, working with customers

column1: Yoco is looking for an Executive Assistant to work in close collaboration with the four Directors to provide administrative support. Effectively helping the Executive team to make the best use of their time by dealing with clerical and administrative tasks. You will be the first assistant hired into the venture, employing 110 people across two offices in Cape Town and Johannesburg.

Yoco is growing fast since launching in late 2015 from Cape Town. The venture has on-boarded over 40 000 merchants to use its point-of-sale payments solution, the venture is on a national and international expansion path. Linked to this are the growth of the team and general operations. Travel needs and general coordination of logistics surrounding the directors has increased significantly, and they can use a hand.

The executive team is looking for a level-minded individual who possesses excellent oral and written communications skills and can organise their work using tools and technology. Efficiency, a low-touch approach and general comfort with technology tools are essential.
ROLE | WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING?

We are looking for a responsible Executive Assistant to perform a variety of administrative and clerical tasks. Duties will include providing support to the Directors on general administrative activities such as travel arrangements and meetings.
Ultimately, a successful Executive Assistant should ensure the efficient and smooth day-to-day operation of the Directors office.
• Screening external phone calls, enquiries and requests, and handling them when appropriate.
• Meeting and greeting visitors at all levels of seniority.
• Organising and maintaining diaries and scheduling appointments.
• Book travel arrangements, including flights, transportation, visas and accommodation.
• Collating, reconciling and submitting expense reports.

• Liaise with executive and senior administrative assistants to handle requests and queries from senior managers.
• Occasional support with personal administration if it impacts work responsibilities during business hours.
• Keeping track of task requests and proactively communicating status.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• Applies sound judgement and context when making decisions
• Highly organised and able to work independently
• Comfortable with uncertainty in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
• Builds great relationships both inside and outside the organisation
• Excellent software skills and willingness to learn new software

>Play an active role in organising and attending talent events.

>Act as a thinking partner when it comes to team design.&nbsp
>Ensure that the candidate experience is smooth from first contact to on-boarding.
>Collaborate with all members of the recruiting team to ensure optimal delivery of recruitment objectives into the business and continuous improvement.

>We have a rare opportunity to head up an area. A design leader to chart the way on design craft and thinking for our established products, and on brave new horizons too. You’ll grow and develop our exceptional team of designers. In fact, you can see what they are looking for from a manager in some of their own words. This is a chance to shape not just the future of Yoco’s products, but also how we practice design at Yoco.

>Yoco uses modern, customer-centred working practices. We run discoveries to understand the user job to be done, build prototypes to test our solutions, and use data, experiments, and feedback to iterate and run live products. Our goal is that cross-functional teams of product managers, designers, engineers, and data analysts have the autonomy and support to achieve their goals as they see fit. You can see a recent product we launched here and a bit about how we work here.

1643196,1040326,Senior Product Manager,false,true,false,"

Yoco is looking for a senior product manager to join our growing team, as we develop products for small businesses across South Africa and beyond. We are seeking someone with a passion and depth of experience in solving problems and building successful products that customers love and can rely on. Ideally, we imagine you should have a few solid years of product experience behind you and feel ready to meet the demands of leading emerging Yoco products.

Your responsibilities will encompass the ideation, planning and execution of product strategy for products either in payments, business management, lending, accounts and point-of-sale producrs. At Yoco, working on Product means you will be part of a team building the tools and services that thousands of people use to run their businesses daily.
• Define the Product Strategy and vision for the collection of products you manage and innovate.
• Build deep insights and empathy with your customers, identifying problems and opportunities to solve them.
• Be the expert for your products, know your customers, competitors, and industry
• Create, drive, and communicate an evolving agile roadmap that takes into account customer needs, market trends, and business objectives
• Identify, measure, and validate customer needs and market opportunities quickly and iteratively
• Collaborate closely with UX, design, data science, developers and external partners in the excecution of your Product Strategy
• Plan and execute successful product betas and launches with multiple teams across the business.
• Evaluate the impact and revenue contribution of the products you manage.
• Lead, guide, and coach junior product managers to enable organisational growth and long-term success of the Yoco Product.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• 5+ years proven experience as a Product Manager or in a similar role
• Passion for product development with an extraordinary attention to detail
• Experience working with or managing cross-functional teams
• Able to identify and implement product experiments
• Experience in using data and metrics in decision making
• Strong written, visual, and oral communication skills
• Experience within financial services or fintech is beneficial

At Yoco we create spaces to explore, we keep it simple, we stay connected to our customers and product and work towards mastering our craft. Joining our team provides valuable experience in your career as a Developer. As a member of the Yoco team, you will play a key role in the growth of the mobile Point of Sale opportunity in South Africa. To support this, we have built a role-based organisation where every individual is given the space to focus and develop their innate strengths.

Everyone at Yoco has the opportunity to lead a project and become a specialist, enabling flexibility, collaboration and accountability at all levels. And you will be working with a diverse, motivated and skilled team.
Join us on a meaningful journey at Yoco, and help enable South Africa to thrive through Open Commerce!

Yoco encourages applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply. Open positions at Yoco are competitive and we often receive high volumes of applicants. If you have not received further updates on your application after three weeks, you’re welcome to request feedback.

ROLE | WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING?

<div>Customer Success sits at the centre of customer experience, business revenue drivers and technology. We get our hands dirty in the detail, think big picture and drive projects that will have a large individual and cumulative impact on the merchant base, organisation and our offerings.&nbsp

<div>We are expanding the team and are looking for someone who is wanting to catapult their career by driving exceptional onboarding and activation experiences to our fast growing customer base across multiple products. This role has great growth potential because of the scope of the team, the growth of the Yoco&rsquo
column2: s customer base and product lines and the growth of the Customer Success team within Yoco.&nbsp

column1: <div>You will be building the onboarding flows to nurture and nudge our customers to be great users and better businesses. At scale, this requires the ability to drive behaviour through the understanding of the desired outcome, the user, the data triggers and the right message using the right channel. You will work with the team to design and refine the onboarding experience and be expected to drive projects to completion by working within the CS team and collaborating with other teams, like product, design, operations, marketing, growth and external stakeholders.&nbsp

<div>In order to drive the right outcomes through the right message on the right medium at the right time to the right customer, you will need a strong ability to exercise customer empathy, a strong understanding of the possibilities of technology, the ability to create without constraints, but deliver quick results, critically analyse processes and communication and be comfortable with briefing in work to others.&nbsp
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?:
• 2 - 4 years relevant experience in a high-performance role
• Customer Communications across Multiple Channels and Stages of a Campaign
• Graphics: ability to communicate a brief in, anything above is a bonus
• Video: ability to storyboard and brief in, anything above is a bonus
<li>At least one of is a bonus
<li>Work with the others to design and implement onboarding flows that deliver an amazing customer experience and great business outcomes.&nbsp
• Leverage new and existing tools and technologies.
• Deliver work across customer journeys: segments, users and products.
• Deliver work across channels: native apps, web apps, support centre, email, text, email, workflows and audio-visual.
• Deliver work across media types: workflows and click-throughs, video, text and images.

column1: Payments is one of the largest untapped opportunities in South Africa. There are over 500,000 small businesses in South Africa that struggle to accept cards. Yoco makes it possible for any business in South Africa, no matter their size or setup, to accept card payments.
To do this, Yoco has changed the rules of the game. By transforming the ever so dull payment experience, making it smarter, simpler and delightful.

Smarter: Traditional card terminals are fixed, clunky and do little except process a payment and issue a paper receipt. Yoco offers an integrated cash register and card terminal that runs on your smartphone or tablet. Transforming a once disjointed experience to a more seamless, digital and mobile experience.
Simpler: Getting a card terminal from a bank. A once cumbersome, manual process that took weeks if not months, has now been reduced to a 1-step process that takes minutes.

Delightful: We've redesigned the card payment experience with both the merchant and customer in mind. The receipt is now paperless, the check-out time faster, the cash-up painless, sales tracking more accurate and more useful. With a goal of giving small businesses more time to deliver their great products and services, and customers more time to enjoy the goods they just purchased.

1547968,982052,Outbound Sales Representative,false,true,false,"

The Outbound Sales Team, and the whole Yoco company in general, is experiencing rapid growth, and with all of this going on, we&rsquo
column2: ve got sales on the brain. Ok, who are we kidding? We always have sales on the brain. Over the last past few months we have noticed a rapid interest of Yoco within the Gauteng Province.

column1: The Outbound Sales candidate will be expected assist in crushing our monthly goals as well as their own personal Targets set out. So, what exactly will you do?

The Outbound Sales candidate is expected to prospect super targeted leads based around specific accounts/markets/areas that have been identified as ideal customers. From there, the incumbent will manage their day around building meaningful relationships while prospecting and demonstrating our Yoco offering to interested businesses.

• Work directly with customers face to face and via telephone, and email to describe products and/or services in order to persuade potential and current customers to purchase new products and/or services.
• Educates customers on product offerings and services to improve their ""on-line presence"" and explains pricing and answers questions from customers building value in the customer relationship.
• Follows up with customer via telephone or email following initial sales contact.
• Identifies customer issues and provides appropriate solutions via up sell of additional products and or services and obtains customer commitment and facilitates delivery of product.
• Complete basic Rates Negotiation with Merchants where required.
• Provide alternative solutions for integration possibilities and have the ability to discuss the usage and services listed of these products.
• Continued product education to better service customer calls.
• Maintains accurate daily record of sales in sales tracker.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• Minimum of 2 years' experience in B2B sales in a high volume fast, paced environment - preferably outbound.
• Strategical business understanding of the geographical and industrial market in the Gauteng region - more specifically Pretoria.
• Previous experience and/or strong interest in outbound sales and prospecting.
• Good organisational skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritise in a high-volume, fast paced environment.
• Solid understanding and experience of Web Based Applications and CRM software.
• Ability to manage sensitive and critical client information.
• Need to have access to a vehicle for daily usage.

column5: >evaluation programs that enhance the YOCO customer engagement output. It should unearth root- cause of problems, possible solutions and provide actionable insight for performance improvements. Working in partnership with the operations leadership an evaluation form, along with the process of disseminating the information to ensure improvements, should be documented as part of an overall plan.

column3: >The primary task of the quality analyst/assessor is call/interaction monitoring and providing actionable insight. Through call monitoring, a QA analyst will gather information to help improve consultant performance. An evaluation form will be used to capture the information. Calibration sessions are required to ensure that all key departments are calibrated on what constitutes a quality call. These sessions are an opportunity to discuss issues and trends as well as cover any new material. Evaluation forms are living documents and should not be set in stone. As the quality assurance process matures, improvements will be identified and the form will evolve.
>The true value of this role will come when improvements in agent behavior, sales performance, and the customer experience are achieved.
>Interpret and implement quality assurance standards and procedures
>Devise sampling procedures and directions for recording and reporting quality data
>Review the implementation and efficiency of quality and inspection systems
>Plan, conduct and monitor testing and inspection of materials and products to ensure finished product quality
>Document internal audits and other quality assurance activities
>Analyze data to identify areas for improvement in the quality system
>develop, recommend and monitor corrective and preventive actions
>Prepare reports to communicate outcomes of quality activities
>Identify training needs and organize training interventions to meet quality standards
>Co-ordinate and support on-site audits conducted by external providers
>Evaluate audit findings and implement appropriate corrective actions
>Assure ongoing compliance with quality and industry regulatory requirements

>Yoco is a payments business at its core, we obsess about making payments as simple and delightful as possible. In our scale up stage, it is key to understand the payments user behaviour in order to diagnose, improve and optimise user experience. Alongside the core payments product, Yoco also offers Capital and other small business tools to make running a small business as easy as possible. The purpose of the role is to set up the tools and practices to make Yoco’s product analytics function exceptional.

IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING?
>Build out the Product Analytics capability at Yoco.

>The broader product analytics team is embedded into small, autonomous pods orientated around a particular product. You will be responsible for the craft of product analytics across the various development pods. As a lead in this space you will coach and manage a group of product analysts, bringing statistical rigour and becoming a technical role model.
>Create a generalised, repeatable framework for analysing user behaviour in digital platforms.

>Key to the role is building a platform that enables rapid visual analysis by all stakeholders. This encompasses the entire framework from initial setup, standardising tagging within and across platforms, and metadata management, to front-end set up and user training.
>Support Product Managers to implement and rapidly iterate through the build, measure and learn loop.
>Ensure that data is a consideration throughout the software development lifecycle by partnering with Product Managers at the outset and feeding back to Engineering to ensure data quality.
>Define great metrics to align the team.

>Parse product objectives into measurable KPIs and perform the analysis, to not only measure success but also to provide insights into explaining user behaviour and proposing experiments to validate hypotheses.

>IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?

Key requirements to perform responsibilities:

Background:
>An Analytics Lead or experienced Data Analyst with a specific focus on product analytics
>Experience in working in either a product-led, growth-focused or technology organisation, ideally working together and collaborating with product managers and other business stakeholders

>Familiarity with a variety of Data Analytics tools, from business intelligence, and experimentation to causal inference, and interacting with databases at scale (SQL, Python, etc). You know when to pick the right tool, and can help others do the same
>A generalist analytical thinker with a strong technical foundation (Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science or Actuarial Science) looking to apply familiar techniques to product analytics
>5+ years in an Data, Engineering or Product Management role
>Experience analysing and visualising event streams in web and app contexts
>Experience with experimentation, A/B testing and funnel building with large datasets
>Experience with event streams and mobile app measurement

1650368,1044441,Lead UX Architecture Designer,false,true,false,"

Yoco is looking for an experienced UX Architecture Designer, to partner with UI designers and our Technology and Product teams on key projects, who has a passion for mobile application design.

We are wanting someone who is passionate about developing product design strategies based on the insights of real people and is specialized in turning these insights into highly functional and attractive experiences.
You'll be part of building the tools that thousands of people use to run their businesses and serve their customers every day.
• Design, own and pioneer UX architecture across Yoco's product suite.
• Take full responsibility for your work, owning the UX architecture space.
• Offer UX architecture direction, feedback and support during design critiques.
• Create delightful, elegant and effective solutions to complex problems.
• Be informed by user research, insights and interactions.
• Brainstorm, iterate and test concepts and prototypes with real users.
• Collaborate closely and successfully negotiate with Software Engineers to get your designs built into iOS, Android, and Web applications.
• Help us scale our product design capabilities in terms of teams, tools and structures.
• Keep yourself and the rest of the Studiyo team up to date with the latest trends, techniques and technologies in UX product design and your wider field.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• 4+ years of commercial UX Architecture Design experience across Android, iOS and web.
• Strong architecture thinker: structures and flow design, from a strong user perspective.
• At least 5 - 8 years’ work experience within design, software development, or related field.
• Strong ‘mobile-first’ thinking, able to design for the unique challenges of various mobile devices.
• Strong ability to collaborate closely with researchers, UI designers, developers, copywriters and product managers.
• Experience partnering with cross-functional teams in launching new products and improvements to existing features.
• Experience facilitating mini-design sprints or design workshops and mentoring other designers.
• Able to mentor and partner with other UX/UI designers.
• Values the craft of product design, showing empathy for customers.
• Driven to ship your designs: understand that the ultimate value of design is only seen once shipped to a customer.
• Current or previous experience with design systems.
• Current or previous experience in Financial Services – advantageous.

2698451,1609600,Front-End Software Engineer,false,true,false,"

Help us build the future of commerce and empower small businesses to grow.

Are you a front end developer looking for your next challenge? Would you like to join a team of passionate, talented front end developers ready to build next-generation mobile and web applications to empower the small businesses of tomorrow? Then keep reading.

Yoco is an African technology company that builds tools and services to help small businesses get paid, run their business better, and grow. We believe that by opening up more possibilities for entrepreneurs to be successful, we can help create more jobs, enable people to thrive and help to drive our economy forward.
We are on the lookout for a front end developer comfortable with modern technologies such as React, and Typescript to take Yoco's applications up a notch.
Great. Broadly speaking, what does this role involve?
• Build, maintain and release our React Native (iOS and Android) applications as well as our React web portal.
• Working with our Product Managers as well as our design and UX minds to ensure that we deliver continuous business value to our growing base of customers.
• Doing the hard and complicated to make it easier and simple.
Okay, now I'm really intrigued. What are you looking for in the the ideal candidate?
• You have 4+ years as a professional Software Engineer.
• You preferably have experience with React (and maybe even React Native) - we're open to experience in other modern Javascript frameworks.
• You are passionate about delivering high quality and beautiful products that are amazing for users.
• You build re-usable solutions that others can use to avoid re-inventing the wheel every time.
• Bonus points for any native mobile experience, or backend development experience.
Tell me more about Yoco's employee culture. What's it like working with you?
The Yoco Formula is our approach to how we work, as well as a set of behaviours that inspire us to create the best solutions for our customers. The Formula has a few components:

column3: >Yoco is here to open up commerce. We are an African technology company that builds tools and services to help small businesses get paid, run their business better, and grow. We believe that by opening up more possibilities for more entrepreneurs to be successful, we can help create more jobs, enable people to thrive and help the economy forward.

>This is a rare and exciting role for our first head of a product department in a growing team. It’s a chance to shape not just the future of our products, but also how we practice product at Yoco.&nbsp

>You will either lead or establish a significant product department. You will set the strategy for this area, and lead a set of product teams to enact the strategy. You’ll manage and develop product managers.&nbsp

>Today, Yoco uses modern and customer-centred working practices. Our goal is that our cross-functional teams of product managers, designers, engineers, and data analysts have the autonomy and support to achieve their goals as they see fit. We run discovery to understand the user job to be done, build prototypes to test our solutions, and use data, experiments, and feedback to iterate and run live products. column2: >During 2013, the Yoco co-founders invested a full year to secure the first merchant aggregation license for mPOS in South Africa. Starting from first principles and taking a risk-based approach, they built up a blueprint for the business which gave banking partners and regulators comfort and has ultimately set the business up for scale.

>Yoco ended 2019 having acquired 66K+ merchants to date and processing over R6BN in transaction volume in 2019. Our ambition is to continue doubling the business by innovating to increase small business access to these important payment acceptance services. By number of merchants, Yoco is set to become SA’s largest acquirer over the next 18 months and alongside important regulatory changes is building stronger relationships with regulators in South Africa. As our regulatory universe expands and the business becomes more complex the need for a dedicated focus on risk and compliance is required.

>We are looking for someone to establish the risk and compliance unit at Yoco - this unit will be responsible for supporting the executive in engaging with regulators as well as working across the business, taking a consultative approach, to ensure Yoco is able to continue innovating, applying enterprise-wide risk management and increasing access to key financial tools for small businesses.
>Developing and maintaining risk management and compliance frameworks
>Assisting the organisation in license applications and acting as the key liaison person with regulators
>Cultivating an empowering risk culture in the company
>Advising the business and management team on risk and regulatory requirements
>Regularly driving adequacy and effectiveness assessments of existing operations
>Working with teams across the business to support the team in appreciating the principles behind key risk and compliance requirements
>Identifying opportunities to more effectively manage risk, improve customer experience and improve operational scalability
>Driving the risk and compliance roadmap, implementing system, product and operational changes to support the strategic goals of the business
>Ensure accurate and timely reporting of risk and compliance related activities to the leadership team, audit committee and regulators as required
>Contributing and supporting the business to maintain a regular cadence of forums and committee meet-ups to facilitate the risk management process

column1: • 5+ years of experience in financial services industry including fintech
• Experience taking a consultative, risk-based, first principles approach to compliance
• Knowledgeable on regulations and risk management best practice
• Experience in license applications and engaging regulators
• Ability to adapt and respond to a fast-paced environment
• A combination of both Global and South African experience

1389664,881722,Business Intelligence Lead,false,true,false,"

Yoco is growing quickly, and so is our data volume, variety and velocity. We are looking for an experienced and entrepreneurially minded individual who can help us keep up with the growth, and identify signal from all of the noise.
This function is critical in increasing the speed of learning and action taking at Yoco, enabling fast feedback loops to support agile decision making.
You will have access to a state of the art tech stack and will be able to conduct analysis at lightning speed, the only thing slowing you down will be the pace at which you can learn.

Setting up a high performing team: You will be setting up a Business Intelligence team at Yoco, working with top management to solve critical business problems using data to determine the impact of specific initiatives.

Increasing data literacy and accuracy with leaders: Key responsibilities are reporting and analysis on KPIs across various operational functions (Sales, Marketing, Customer Operations). Beyond simply preparing dashboards you will be involved in on-going KPI reviews and performance analysis with function owners.

Solving complex problems: Your team will be exploring key business problems with an analytical approach, going deep to identify the root cause and sharing this in a simple fashion, along with proposing solutions.  You will be creating a nuanced understanding of the key operational functions at Yoco, how they interact and connect.

Building and maintaining technical systems: Your team will work closely with the Engineering and Data Science teams to manage and maintain the data pipeline end-to-end. You will be responsible for setting up and scheduling batch jobs to aggregate raw data into useable tables. You will also identify gaps, errors and inconsistencies in data tracking and work with Engineering to rectify these, you will need to create a complete picture of all data within Yoco.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• BSc Computer Science or equivalent analytics/computation degree.

column2: Development, ideally leading a BI team with strong analytical skills.

column1: • Incredibly strong communication skills, particularly data visualisation - creating insight beyond simply results.
• Statistical and business literacy, including KPIs design.
• Strong integrations and API experience, along with systems thinking capabilities.
• Very fast learner and keen to get your hands dirty early on with experiments and hacks.

column1: The Outbound Sales Team, and the whole Yoco company in general, is experiencing rapid growth, and with all of this going on, we&rsquo
column2: ve got sales on the brain. Ok, who are we kidding? We always have sales on the brain. Over the last past few months we have noticed a rapid interest of Yoco within the Gauteng Province.

column1: The Outbound Sales candidate will be expected assist in crushing our monthly goals as well as their own personal Targets set out. So, what exactly will you do?

The Outbound Sales candidate is expected to prospect super targeted leads based around specific accounts/markets/areas that have been identified as ideal customers. From there, the incumbent will manage their day around building meaningful relationships while prospecting and demonstrating our Yoco offering to interested businesses.

• Work directly with customers face to face and via telephone, and email to describe products and/or services in order to persuade potential and current customers to purchase new products and/or services.
• Educates customers on product offerings and services to improve their ""on-line presence"" and explains pricing and answers questions from customers building value in the customer relationship.
• Follows up with customer via telephone or email following initial sales contact.
• Identifies customer issues and provides appropriate solutions via up sell of additional products and or services and obtains customer commitment and facilitates delivery of product.
• Complete basic Rates Negotiation with Merchants where required.
• Provide alternative solutions for integration possibilities and have the ability to discuss the usage and services listed of these products.
• Continued product education to better service customer calls.
• Maintains accurate daily record of sales in sales tracker.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• Minimum of 2 years' experience in B2B sales in a high volume fast, paced environment - preferably outbound.
• Strategical business understanding of the geographical and industrial market in the Gauteng region - more specifically Pretoria.
• Previous experience and/or strong interest in outbound sales and prospecting.
• Good organisational skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritise in a high-volume, fast paced environment.
• Solid understanding and experience of Web Based Applications and CRM software.
• Ability to manage sensitive and critical client information.
• Need to have access to a vehicle for daily usage.
• Ability to work autonomously with fantastic Time Management Skills

column1: <div><span class="" author-d-iz88z86z86za0dz67zz78zz78zz74zz68zjz80zz71z9iz90za3z122z3xtavtviz71zz70ztlz79zgc6d27dez90z6yz90zm7z72z"">Payments is one of the largest untapped opportunities in South Africa. There are over 500,000 small businesses in South Africa that struggle to accept cards. Yoco makes it possible for any business in South Africa, no matter their size or setup, to accept card payments.&nbsp
To do this, Yoco has changed the rules of the game. By transforming the ever so dull payment experience, making it smarter, simpler and delightful.

Smarter: Traditional card terminals are fixed, clunky and do little except process a payment and issue a paper receipt. Yoco offers an integrated cash register and card terminal that runs on your smartphone or tablet. Transforming a once disjointed experience to a more seamless, digital and mobile experience.
Simpler: Getting a card terminal from a bank. A once cumbersome, manual process that took weeks if not months, has now been reduced to a 1-step process that takes minutes.

Delightful: We've redesigned the card payment experience with both the merchant and customer in mind. The receipt is now paperless, the check-out time faster, the cash-up painless, sales tracking more accurate and more useful. With a goal of giving small businesses more time to deliver their great products and services, and customers more time to enjoy the goods they just purchased.

column1: • Have the ability to articulate technical requirements of product development in a coherent and consistent manner
• Be comfortable project managing the pilot of these products including day to day engagements with lending partners and merchants
• Collaborate cross-functionally with almost every other function within Yoco, including Engineering, Design, Data Science, Operations, Marketing, Finance, Legal, Compliance, and Risk
• Work with the team to craft the vision for the lending business
• Prioritise key lending products and develop a robust roadmap to bring these products to market and execute on the vision
• Collaboration with almost every other function within Yoco, particularly the software engineering, customer success and risk teams to continually sense check the roadmap
• Yoco develops products in a thoughtful manner, prioritizing user experience over almost all other factors. In order to achieve this, you will need to:
• Conduct a careful analysis of all proposed user touch-points and journeys for a particular product
• Identify gaps and areas of improvement
• Create a technology specification to implement projects
• Identify areas within the platform for Yoco to perform itself and areas for collaboration
• Selection of best in class partners for identified areas
• Continuous assessment of product fit to merchant needs
• Credit portfolio management - analysing and identifying under and over performing loans, their causality and feeding this data back into segmentation and targeting

• Analytical mindset based on deep customer, product, offering and business understanding
• Working with others, whether they be team members, merchants or partners.
• Experience in credit risk and portfolio management
• Design Thinking applied to product (UX), service, systems and/or communications

column3: >Since our Series B funding round in 2018, Yoco has experienced an exciting period of growth in our customer base and team including the launch of a new lower cost card reader, The Yoco Go, opening up new small business segments to card payments in South Africa and Yoco Capital, a small business financing offering to help our merchants grow.

>We take a first principles approach to deploying capital within the business following a simple three-step process of identifying initiatives with potential, understanding expected returns to allocate capital and then realising benefits over time. As we continue our growth journey, investing in new product teams, deepening our platform, extending our footprint in South Africa and, in-time, opening up in new markets, the business is becoming more complex and the need for a deeper understanding of return on investment is required.
>We’re looking for someone to establish the FP&amp
column4: A unit within the Strategic Finance function at Yoco to support the business in focusing on the key business drivers, analysing data, modelling uncertainty and helping us make important strategic decisions. You’d be working with the product and commercial leads, and alongside the data and finance teams to complete the analysis, and in time be responsible for building a team of analysts to support the business at scale.

column3: >This is an important strategic role with the potential to have a significant impact on how we deploy our capital and grow as a business. The role will need to support the business across a wide-variety of initiatives.

column2: >Evaluating whether the company’s investments are the best use of the company’s capital, by looking at return on investment, benchmarking with other companies and comparisons with other ways the company might utilize its funds
>Gauging the company’s overall financial health, using existing key financial ratios, as well as developing particular metrics suited to the Yoco operation
>Assessing the company’s products or product lines, understanding their strategic and financial value and working with the product managers to develop and review growth and revenue expectations

>Examining and evaluating the cost-efficiency of each department of the company, in light of what percentage of the company’s financial resources each department consumes relative to the value it creates
>Creating, updating, and maintaining financial models and detailed forecasts of the company’s future operations
>Working with individual departments to prepare and rationalise budgets and consolidate them into one overall corporate budget
>Preparing internal reports, conducting ad-hoc analysis for executive and senior leadership and supporting their decision making
>Comparing historical results against budgets and forecasts, and performing variance analysis to explain differences in performance and make improvements going forward
>Considering opportunities for the company to expand or grow. Mapping out growth plans, including capital expenditures and investments. Generating three- to five-year financial forecasts.
>Bachelor's Degree in Data Analytics, Accounting or Finance.
>5+ years experience in Financial Planning and Analysis.
>Strong interpersonal and leadership skills are required.
>Articulate with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
>Ability to think creatively, highly-driven and self-motivated.
>Demonstrated ability to roll-up sleeves and get hands on, working within teams.

1528091,969797,Full-Stack Junior Software Engineer,false,true,false,"

Yoco is looking for Full-stack Junior Software Engineers to join our team.

We are a proudly African technology company that builds tools and services to help small businesses get paid, run their business better, and grow. We believe that by opening up more possibilities for entrepreneurs to be successful, we can help create more jobs, enable people to thrive and help to drive our economy forward.
As a junior developer in the Yoco team, you have a critical role to play in achieving this vision. Start with us, grow with us, learn with us, and make an impact with us.
• Work on diverse set of projects including web front-ends, internal systems, payments, APIs, security, mobile apps
• Collaborate with stakeholders across the organisation such as experts in product, design, infrastructure, and operations.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• Enjoy being a generalist working on both the frontend, backend, and anything it takes to solve problems and delight users both internally and externally
• Take pride in not just starting but also finishing projects
• Can stitch together many different services and processes even if you have not worked with them before
• Can put yourself in the shoes of your users and be a steward of crafting great experiences
• Enjoy working with a diverse group of people with different expertise
• Uphold best practices in engineering, security, and design

At Yoco we create spaces to explore, we keep it simple, we stay connected to our customers and product and work towards mastering our craft. Joining our team provides valuable experience in your career as a Developer.

As part of the Yoco team, you will play a key role in the growth of the mobile Point of Sale opportunity in South Africa. To support this, we have built a role-based organisation where every individual is given the space to focus and develop their innate strengths.

Everyone at Yoco has the opportunity to lead a project and become a specialist, enabling flexibility, collaboration and accountability at all levels. And you will be working with a diverse, motivated and skilled team.
Join us on a meaningful journey at Yoco, and help enable our merchants to thrive through Open Commerce!

Yoco encourages applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply. Open positions at Yoco are highly competitive and we often receive high volumes of applicants. If you have not received further updates on your application after three weeks, you&rsquo

952865,636559,VP - Growth Marketing,false,true,false,"
Yoco has hit the ScaleUp phase and is looking for someone analytical, creative and resourceful to own all facets of growth and marketing.

We are looking for an experienced Vice President (VP) of Growth Marketing to direct and oversee our Marketing department. You will design, implement and monitor effective marketing strategies that align with our business goals.
Our ideal candidate has a solid Marketing background and work experience managing a variety of promotional projects end-to-end, including paid advertising campaigns and digital marketing techniques.

The role will be focused on brand awareness and driving traffic (visitors, leads, signups and merchants), all while improving reach, customer acquisition costs, customer lifetime value and remaining a clear market leader across all our target segments.

1846790,1154858,Operations Coordination Intern,false,true,false,"

This is a part-time internship position within our New Region Development team.
Yoco is looking for an enthusiastic, flexible and quick-learning Operations Coordinator Intern to support in the running of Yoco’s New Region Development activities.

Based in Johannesburg, this is ideal for a detail-focused graduate or someone with up to 1 year of commercial or analytical work experience who is keen to become involved in all aspects of operating a fast-growing start-up.
You will be responsible for assisting with the administration and coordination of Yoco’s New Region Development team activities. The role will include:
Ensuring invoices are submitted to our finance system for payment.
Tracking spend against budgets and researching costs for suppliers to support an Area Lead.
<li>Liaising with Yoco HQ to coordinate production &amp
• Monitoring budgets and stock levels to ensure adequate stock levels are maintained to fulfil forecasted needs.
• Providing general administrative support for marketing activities for each zone.

• Co-ordinating meetings with external and internal stakeholders.

• 1 year of any commercial/analytical work experience.

At Yoco we create space to explore, we keep it simple, we stay connected to our customers and product and work towards mastering our craft. These are our core values and provides every individual at Yoco with an opportunity to grow. To support this, we have built a role-based organisation where every individual is given the space to focus and develop their innate strengths.

Everyone at Yoco has the opportunity to lead a project and become a specialist, enabling flexibility, collaboration and accountability at all levels. You will be working with a diverse, motivated and skilled team who will continuously stretch you as an individual.
Join us on a meaningful journey at Yoco and help enable our merchants to thrive through Open Commerce!

737291,499443,Inbound Sales Consultant,false,true,false,"

Yoco is growing our Business Solutions Consultants team and looking for a top-performing individual interested in furthering their career by the consulting and inbound selling of our product.
Work with a vibrant, smart and energetic team who are social and outgoing.
Build relationships with exciting start-ups and innovative entrepreneurs.

Make a difference to the South African economy by providing businesses with the tools and support to grow their businesses and revenue streams whilst building an eco-system of entrepreneurs and small to medium business owners.

You will gain exposure to the inner workings of a fast-growing startup. From day one, you will be given the opportunity to drive innovation and execute strategies that will take Yoco to the next level.

The role of a Yoco Business Solutions Consultant is focused but not limited to driving sales within the small to medium-sized enterprise segment.  This role will place you at the forefront of Yoco’s growth in its most important segment as well as become part of an amazing team dynamic.
• Answering incoming sales calls and (with some active sales-qualifying), understand merchants business needs and provide the best business solutions.
• Facilitating the customer journey through our online registration with website visitors who are interested in learning more about Yoco.
• Responding to sales inquiries via email and call.
• Work internally with the sales management and marketing teams to ensure proper quality and quantity of leads.
• Management of your accumulated pipeline of potential merchants through the Salesforce CRM to ensure targets are met.
• Cross-functional and collaborative project work to enable your team and the company to focus on customer-centric growth.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

If you are an individual who has at least 1 year of commercial inbound sales experience, is team orientated, enjoys working in a diverse environment, is able to be flexible in the workspace and adapt to changes, has a willingness to go beyond the call of duty from time to time and has the ability to collaborate and work outside of your key responsibilities (cross-functional projects) – we are looking for you!
• Eager to continue their sales career in a high growth company.
• Ability to self-motivate, be target driven and able to manage your time effectively.
• A lifelong learner that loves a challenge and is a true problem-solver
• Excellent communication skills - both written and verbal
• Ability to take initiative and proactively seek out the resources needed to solve the problem at hand.
• Ability to easily adapt to a number of environments.
• Ability to drive your own boat: the ability to fearlessly use the resources at your fingertips to resolve technical challenges especially when you don't know the answer.
• Tech-Savvy and knowledge of the South African Fintech industry
• Knowledge of payments and the mobile Point of Sale space

column2: >We are looking for an experienced training and development manager to devise Yoco and Customer Operations training strategy, overseeing its implementation and assess its outcomes. column3:
You will identify training and developmental needs and drive suitable training initiatives that build loyalty to Yoco Customer Operations and the rest of the company.

Training managers work across many departments to get employees up to speed in both their specific vertical, and the overall needs of the company. Training managers often have backgrounds in business, leadership, human resources, development and education. A technical background will add value.

Training manager responsibilities include enhancing employees&rsquo
column4: skills, performance, productivity and quality of work.

column1: The People and Culture team is looking for a Technical Recruiter to help Yoco grow.
Yoco is an African technology company that builds tools and services to help small businesses get paid, run their business better, and grow.

We believe that by opening up more possibilities for entrepreneurs to be successful, we can help create more jobs, enable people to thrive and help to drive our economy forward. To make this happen we need smart, passionate talent who wants to be part of something bigger than themselves.

The People and Culture team is looking for a Technical Recruiter who could help us find this talent in a highly competitive market. The ideal candidate will be innovative, strategic and have extensive experience as a technical recruiter.

You will have the opportunity to partner with our application engineering, design, product and operational scalability teams to craft strategies that will attract and retain the best technical talent and enable us to continuously give our customers the products and services that will help them grow.
<li>Play an active role in building Yoco&rsquo
• Use data and insights to build technical talent pipelines and assist with talent planning.
• Partner with leadership to develop an acquisition strategy for technical talent.
• Build and leverage multiple recruitment channels to attract the best talent.
• Play an active role in organising and attending tech and other events.
• Optimise recruitment processes to ensure that our processes are effective and scalable.
<li>Train and coach hiring manager on writing technical job specs and conducting interviews. Act as a thinking partner when it comes to team design.&nbsp
• Ensure that the candidate experience is smooth from first contact to on-boarding.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?

column2: s Degree or higher in a relevant field.

column1: <li>5+ years of relevant working experience in recruitment - proven experience as a technical recruiter.&nbsp
• Experience in financial services or financial technology environments.
• Ability to manage multiple projects and work streams independently.
• Fantastic customer service ethic, high expectations for quality and attention to detail.
• Ability to solve complex people problems, make decisions and provide expert advice.
• Self-directed, willing to experiment and not afraid to fail.

column2: influence: Strong communication skills across various mediums, building collaborative relationships internally and externally.
solve problems: Diagnostic information gathering and research, analytical thinking, application of conceptual thinking to problem-solving.
Proactive/initiative, customer orientated, fostering innovation, continuous improvement mindset, appreciation of results, business acumen, thoroughness and detail orientated.

To support this we have built a role-based organisation
column2: where every individual is given the space to focus and develop his or her innate strengths. Everyone here has the opportunity to lead a project and become a specialist, enabling flexibility, collaboration and accountability at all levels.&nbsp

column1: Please Note: Thank you for taking the time to apply for this role. Please note that, at times, we receive large volumes of applications and this makes for an extremely competitive selection process. Should you not receive feedback from us within 4 weeks (depending on the urgency to hire), this would mean we are unable to move forward with your application. However, should anything change on our end, we will definitely reach out to you.

column2: Logistics team is looking for a driven, process-oriented individual to help us set up and run our Retail Operations function at Yoco. This is an opportunity for an individual with 2 - 3 years of Analyst experience to join the team at an intermediate level.

column1: This role involves a great deal of multitasking and communication across a wide variety of platforms, and covers the end to end Retail process, dealing with both Retailers and end customers.
• Deliver key service level performance indicators with Retail partners:  Distribution, Stock and Performance.
• Inventory and Stock management (Inventory levels and Forecasting).
• Maintain Relationships with existing suppliers and Retailers while seeking improvement with current structures.
• Using existing Data to make analytical and strategic decisions.
• Work closely with relevant team leads to ensure strategic alignment.
• Prioritise feedback from teams on internal systems and seek continuous improvement.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• 2- 3 years of related industry experience as a buyer or a planner
• Experience in working as a buyer or planner for a retailer

At Yoco we create spaces to explore, we keep it simple, we stay connected to our customers and product and work towards mastering our craft. Joining our team provides valuable experience in your career.

As part of the Yoco team, you will play a key role in the growth of the mobile Point of Sale opportunity in South Africa. To support this, we have built a role-based organisation where every individual is given the space to focus and develop their innate strengths.

Everyone at Yoco has the opportunity to lead a project and become a specialist, enabling flexibility, collaboration and accountability at all levels. And you will be working with a diverse, motivated and skilled team.
Join us on a meaningful journey at Yoco, and help enable our merchants to thrive through Open Commerce!

Yoco encourages applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply. Open positions at Yoco are competitive and we often receive high volumes of applicants. If you have not received further updates on your application after three weeks, you’re welcome to request feedback.

652025,439493,Product Manager,false,true,false,"
Yoco is looking for a product manager to help enhance our product offering to Yoco merchants, specifically looking at our Point of Sale initially. The ideal candidate has extensive experience as a product manager for SME or small business solutions and has performed well previously in a rapidly changing and growing organization.
ROLE | WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING?
• Develop product strategy and roadmaps for features related to our Point of sale, and SME focused business solutions.
• Along with engineering leadership, develop appropriate planning, prioritization, and release management processes to enable us to launch new features across Android, iOS, and Desktop / Web.
• Drive superb execution against plan, anticipating staffing needs, risks, and the need for frequent and clear communication internally and with customers.
• Prioritize and design features for the thousands of customers who use Yoco to grow and manage their businesses every day.

<li><span class="" author-d-iz88z86z86za0dz67zz78zz78zz74zz68zjz80zz71z9iz90za3z122z3xtavtviz71zz70ztlz79zgc6d27dez90z6yz90zm7z72z"">Manage the rollout of beta programs, the onboarding of our initial customer base, and the P&amp
• Develop effective reports that help the rest of the company understand the performance of the various product lines you manage.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• Product management experience building and maintaining mobile products and features Strong technical background to enable you to contribute meaningfully to features.
• A good understanding of the problems that small businesses face, and a willingness to hit the ground and get your hands dirty.
• Passionate about Yoco and the problem we are solving
• Natural talent for mediating competing interests and finding creative solutions
• Great track record of working with engineering and design teams: people want to work with you again

column1: Yoco is building our Customer Growth team and are searching for a top-performing, ambitious individual, interested in furthering their career by providing business solutions to our existing Merchant base.
Work with a vibrant, smart and energetic team who are social and outgoing.
Build relationships with exciting start-ups and innovative entrepreneurs.

Make a difference to the South African economy by providing businesses with the tools and support to grow their businesses and revenue streams whilst building an eco-system of entrepreneurs and small to medium business owners.

You will gain exposure to the inner workings of a fast-growing startup. From day one, you will be given the opportunity to drive innovation and execute strategies that will take Yoco to the next level.
The role of a Yoco Business Growth Specialist is focused, but not limited to communicating the value of Yocos after-acquisition product portfolio.
column2: This role will place you at an essential part Yoco&rsquo
column3: s growth in a key segment as well as become part of an amazing team dynamic.

column1: • Understanding the key segments of our merchant base and their individual requirements by building relationships through email and telephonic communication
• Facilitating the customer journey and increasing their LTV. Primarily through the selling of our Capital Products.
• Facilitating the initiation and adoption of additional Yoco product offerings to the merchant base
• Providing information and feedback to the Customer Success teams on merchant sentiment and best ways to approach segments according to offerings and requirements
• Ensure that your targets on Capital Products are met.
• Management of your accumulated pipeline of potential merchants through the Salesforce CRM to ensure targets are met.
• Cross-functional and collaborative project work to enable your team and the company to focus on customer-centric growth.
IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

If you are an individual who has natural business flair, is team orientated, enjoys working in a diverse environment, is able to be flexible in the workspace and adapt to changes, has a willingness to go beyond the call of duty from time to time and has the ability to collaborate and work outside of your key responsibilities (cross-functional projects) &ndash
• Has at least 12 months of multi-industry B2B sales or account management experience preferably in the Retail, Hospitality, Health and Beauty or Financial Services Sectors
• Be able to communicate to business prospects over the phone on how Yoco Capital products would grow their business
• Eager to continue their sales and account management career in a high-performance company.
• Ability to self-motivate, be target driven and able to manage your time effectively.
• Lifelong learner who loves a challenge and is a true problem-solver
• Excellent communication skills - both written and verbal
• Ability to take initiative and proactively seek out the resources needed to solve the problem at hand.
• Ability to easily adapt to a number of environments.
• Ability to drive your own boat: the ability to fearlessly use the resources at your fingertips to resolve technical challenges especially when you don't know the answer.
• Tech-Savvy and knowledge of the South African Fintech industry
• Knowledge of payments and the mobile Point of Sale space

<div><span class="" author-d-16z86ztz122z98z81zz82zz85zunv3z82zpqfnlamlz122zvz82zz82zxw4hz86zz76zz86zdz68zdxz81zz76z8z82zz65zz87zxz67zz78zh"">We are building our our payment operations team, and moving from it being part of the technology unit to it being a sub unit of our operations team. &nbsp
column2: As the first manager in this team you will be responsible, together with our heads of product and operations for laying the foundations for an area that will manage one of the most important parts of Yoco, our payments.

column1: <div><span class="" author-d-16z86ztz122z98z81zz82zz85zunv3z82zpqfnlamlz122zvz82zz82zxw4hz86zz76zz86zdz68zdxz81zz76z8z82zz65zz87zxz67zz78zh"">Your focus, and that of the entire payment operations team, will be to help our payments business scale with ease and confidence, and support the development and management of new payments features. &nbsp
column2: As part of the Yoco Operations team you will partner with our external vendors and work closely with them and the product, engineering, data and finance teams - among others, with your key goal being to delivery the best possible payments experience for our merchants and manage issues in a manner that insures our merchants are never exposed to the inner complexities of the payment world.

column1: ROLE | WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?
As the Payments Operations Manager you&rsquo
• Payment issues from beginning to end, working with our payments team and external partners to troubleshoot and resolve issues in a systematic and timely fashion.
• Collaborate with the leadership of the payments, operations and data team to develop the area of Payment Operations into a high performing unit within the organization.
• Develop and design processes to manage incidents with processes that reduce the requirement for firefighting.

>Yoco is looking for an exceptional individual to become our new VP of Application Engineering. The VP of Application Engineering will help us make our engineering organisation successful in our challenges ahead. The ideal candidate enjoys mentoring engineers and will enable them to be successful employees at Yoco. Help them grow within the company and help us hire talented people that fit our company culture and values. This person will have a huge role in hiring new engineers, coaching engineers, designing how we do engineering, and deciding when it's time for someone to move on.

>Together with our Head of Product and our Head of Product Design you will lead our Product and Product Delivery teams. This leader must be a deep technologist, possess proven expertise in enhancing productivity and growing engineering teams.

column1: • Ensure the team is set-up for long term success.

• Be an innovator in how we work so that we can achieve innovative goals.
• Create visibility info engineering for those who have limited experience with the area.
• Organise and adhere to tight schedules and working with others to ensure everyone is on track to reach their assigned goals within the allocated time frame.

• Help employees grow through career development, coaching, and mentoring while guiding senior contributors to maximise their potential. You'll provide a clear path for progression through personal development plans, defining goals, perform evaluations, and collaborate with employees on their objectives.
• Collaborate on roadmaps with Product Managers, Architects, Engineering Managers to ensure the teams have clear direction and priorities

>The People and Culture team is looking for an experienced Technical Recruiter to partner closely with Technical Business Leaders in order to meet the requirements of the annual hiring plan, whilst ensuring an efficient recruitment process and an unforgettable candidate experience. The ideal candidate will be well versed in full life cycle recruitment, be adept at using recruitment systems, building great relationships and have a solid track record in technical recruitment service delivery.&nbsp

column2: >Yoco is a remote-first company, and will accept applications from anywhere in South Africa.&nbsp

column3: >Partner with leadership to deliver on the acquisition strategy for technical talent.
>Manage the full recruitment life cycle for technical roles in the business, using proactive sourcing strategies and multiple recruitment channels.
>Optimise the use of our hiring toolkit (ATS, Career Site, Social Media Platforms, Technical recruitment platforms and job boards) to ensure that our recruiting processes are effective and scalable.
>Play an active role in building Yoco’s Employee Value Proposition for Tech Talent.
>Use data, insights and their own technical talent network to build relevant and sustainable technical talent pipelines and contribute to talent planning.
>Train and coach hiring managers on writing technical job specs and conducting interviews.&nbsp
>Act as a thinking partner when it comes to team design.&nbsp
>Ensure that the candidate experience is smooth from first contact to on-boarding.
>Collaborate with all members of the recruiting team to ensure optimal delivery of recruitment objectives into the business and continuous improvement.

column2: >Yoco is looking for a Retail Account Manager to develop relationships with store managers and store owners, conduct audits and evaluations in our partners retail stores, with the purpose of improving in-store placement, assessing needs for training and ensure marketing and promotional activities are executed correctly.

>Act as an ambassador for Yoco, its products and its merchants.

>Ensure Yoco is stocked in each outlet.

column3: >Yoco is a FinTech company. We focus on building tools and services to help small and micro businesses get paid, run better, and grow. We believe in unlocking entrepreneurial potential anywhere, in empowering people to thrive and in driving our economy forward.

>Yoco was founded in 2013. Today we are a company of over 150 people all driven by a common goal: keeping the needs of our customers at heart. Our vision is Open Commerce and we want to do this to enable people to thrive.

>We strive to delight our customers. The Customer Operations team are on the frontlines, engaging directly with our merchants every day. As Yoco grows, the ways in which we serve our merchants needs to evolve alongside. Data plays a key part in this evolution, infusing processes with intelligence, identifying areas of poor experience and proactively planning for growth, rather than simply reacting to it.
>Your objective will to be to collaborate with the Operations, Product, Engineering and Growth teams to support the building of smart, scalable and delightful operations.

column1: The Outbound Sales Team, and the whole Yoco company in general, is experiencing rapid growth, and with all of this going on, we&rsquo
column2: ve got sales on the brain. Ok, who are we kidding? We always have sales on the brain. Over the last past few months we have noticed a rapid interest of Yoco within the Gauteng Province.

column1: The Outbound Sales candidate will be expected assist in crushing our monthly goals as well as their own personal Targets set out. So, what exactly will you do?

The Outbound Sales candidate is expected to prospect super targeted leads based around specific accounts/markets/areas that have been identified as ideal customers. From there, the incumbent will manage their day around building meaningful relationships while prospecting and demonstrating our Yoco offering to interested businesses.

• Work directly with customers face to face and via telephone, and email to describe products and/or services in order to persuade potential and current customers to purchase new products and/or services.
• Educates customers on product offerings and services to improve their ""on-line presence"" and explains pricing and answers questions from customers building value in the customer relationship.
• Follows up with customer via telephone or email following initial sales contact.
• Identifies customer issues and provides appropriate solutions via up sell of additional products and or services and obtains customer commitment and facilitates delivery of product.
• Complete basic Rates Negotiation with Merchants where required.
• Provide alternative solutions for integration possibilities and have the ability to discuss the usage and services listed of these products.
• Continued product education to better service customer calls.
• Maintains accurate daily record of sales in sales tracker.

column3: Associate and actively Network and find new business or potential clients.

column1: IDEAL CANDIDATE | WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?
• Minimum of 3 years' experience in B2B sales in a high volume fast, paced environment - preferably outbound.
• Strategical business understanding of the geographical and industrial market in the Gauteng region - more specifically Pretoria.
• Previous experience and/or strong interest in outbound sales and prospecting.
• Good organisational skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritise in a high-volume, fast paced environment.
• Solid understanding and experience of Web Based Applications and CRM software.
• Ability to manage sensitive and critical client information.
• Need to have access to a vehicle for daily usage.
• Ability to work autonomously with fantastic Time Management Skills

To produce and manage video, audio and photography content for Yoco.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING?
• Create and develop multimedia content for merchant stories, product and features demonstrations, promotional social videos, recruiting videos, training and other company-wide projects.
• Work with the Creative Lead to create scripts and storyboards and establish project deliverables based on the brief received or own projects.
• Budget, allocate resources, set deadlines and select optimal forms of media for projects.
• Plan shoots, scout, select and reserve shoot locations.
• Develop production schedules for larger projects.

• Work with Creative Lead and Marketing Managers to analyse all published video content and develop a solid knowledge base of the various social media networks and how video is best targeted to each medium.
